translation: 你走近里卡的咖啡馆，却发现这里一个人也没有。

original: You see a sign on the front door.[p/] It reads "Closed for today".
translation: 你发现前门上挂这一个告示牌，[p/]上面写着“今日打烊”。

original: Celeste: It looks like she closed the restaurant for today.
translation: Celeste: 看来她今天闭馆了。

original: Tyrion: Since the Inquisition is involved now,[p/] they might have taken her in for questioning...
translation: Tyrion: 现在裁判所介入了，[p/]他们应该把她带去问询了……

original: Tyrion: Hm...[p/] I really wanted to go into detail about what she saw.
translation: Tyrion: 嗯……[p/]我很想详细了解一下她所看见的。

original: Tyrion: But it looks like we'll have to go somewhere else.
translation: Tyrion: 但看来我们只能去其他地方了。

original: Tyrion: There are some barrels stacked in the corner here.
translation: Tyrion: 角落里有些木桶叠在一起。

original: Celeste: I wonder what's inside.
translation: Celeste: 我很好奇里面是什么。

original: Celeste: Wait...[p/] Rika.[p/] You wouldn't happen to have Lotus Juice, do you?
translation: Celeste: 等等……[p/]里卡，[p/]你该不会有莲之水吧？

original: Mosourika: "Lotus Juice"? [p/] What's that?
translation: Mosourika: “莲之水”？ [p/]那是什么东西？

original: Celeste: *sigh*[p/] Never mind.
translation: Celeste: *叹气*[p/]没什么。

original: Tyrion: What happened to the Lotus Juice that you "received" from Miriam?
translation: Tyrion: 你从米莉亚姆那“收到”的莲之水怎么样了？

original: Celeste: I drank all of it…
translation: Celeste: 我全部喝掉了……

original: Already...?[p/] It hasn't even been a month.
translation: 已经喝掉了？[p/]还没过去一个月呢。

original: Tyrion: This table looks [i]really[/i] well-made.
translation: Tyrion: 这张桌子做得<u>很</u>不错。

original: Mosourika: You like it?[p/] I commissioned a local carpenter to have my tables custom-made.
translation: Mosourika: 你喜欢它吗？[p/]我委托了一个当地的木匠为我定制桌子。

original: Celeste: It was probably worth it.
translation: Celeste: 还是很值的。

original: Celeste: They fit with the humble and rustic vibe you've got going on here.
translation: Celeste: 它们与这里质朴的氛围很搭。

original: Rika seems to have decorated the entire café with several plants and flowers.
translation: 里卡用几株植物和花装饰了整个咖啡厅。

original: The greens add a fresh and earthy ambiance to the restaurant.
translation: 翠绿的植物给咖啡店添加了一丝新鲜质朴的氛围。

original: There are artificer lights hanging from the ceiling.
translation: 有精巧的人造灯具悬挂在天花板上。

original: Tyrion: Your business must be doing pretty well if you can afford artificery like this.
translation: Tyrion: 能负担得起像这样的奥术能源，你的生意一定很好。

original: Mosourika: That's just one of the benefits I get from working with the Dracogen Trading Company.
translation: Mosourika: 这只是我与德拉科根贸易公司合作所获得的好处之一。

original: Mosourika: Most of the merchants equip all of their businesses with artificery networks now.
translation: Mosourika: 大多数商人现在都为他们的生意配备了奥术能源。

original: There's a shelf full of drinks,[p/] mugs,[p/] and sugar behind the restaurant counter.
translation: 在餐厅柜台后面有一个架子，上面放满了饮料、[p/]杯子、[p/]奶油[p/]和糖。

original: This must be where Rika's employees prepare coffee to be served.
translation: 这里一定是里卡的员工准备咖啡的地方。

original: Mosourika: So...[p/] Are you going to introduce us?
translation: Mosourika: 所以……[p/]你会介绍我们吗？

original: Tyrion: Right...
translation: Tyrion: 对……

original: Tyrion: This is Celeste McCoy.
translation: Tyrion: 这位是塞莱斯特·麦考伊。

original: Tyrion: ...She's my bodyguard.
translation: Tyrion: 她是我的贴身护卫。

original: Mosourika: ...Bodyguard?
translation: Mosourika: ……贴身护卫？

original: Tyrion: And Celeste, this is-
translation: Tyrion: 塞莱斯特，这位是——

original: Mosourika: Ha![p/][s/] As if I need such introductions!
translation: Mosourika: 哈！[p/][s/]我就不用这样介绍了！

original: Mosourika: [i]I[/i] am Mosourika Tudor:[p/][s/] Dark Lord of Aurinax,[p/][s/] High Archmagi of the Cadmium Flames,[p/][s/] and the proud proprietor of this café!
translation: Mosourika: <u>我</u>是莫苏里卡·都铎：[p/][s/]欧奥耐克斯的黑暗领主，[p/][s/]镉之火焰的最高大法师，[p/][s/]以及这家咖啡馆的骄傲的店主！

original: Celeste: O-[p/]Oh...[p/] Okay.
translation: Celeste: 噢、[p/]噢……[p/]好的。

original: Tyrion: I was friends with her when I used to live here.
translation: Tyrion: 我以前住在这里的时候和她是朋友。

original: Tyrion: She's a little eccentric,[p/] but she's a good person at heart.
translation: Tyrion: 她有点古怪，[p/]但她本性善良。

original: Mosourika: H-[p/][s/]Hey!
translation: Mosourika: 嘿-[p/][s/]嘿！

original: Tyrion: She's also a commonfolk mage like you.
translation: Tyrion: 她也是个和你一样的平民法师。

original: Mosourika: Ah![p/] So you come from the same humble beginnings that I do.
translation: Mosourika: 啊！[p/]就是说你和我一样出身平凡。

original: Mosourika: Which spells have you mastered?
translation: Mosourika: 你现在掌握了什么法术？

original: Celeste: Hm...[p/] I haven't really [i]mastered[/i] any of them.
translation: Celeste: 唔……[p/]我还没有<u>掌握</u>任何法术。

original: Celeste: I know about seven spells, though.
translation: Celeste: 不过我能用的有七种。

original: Mosourika: S-[p/][s/]Seven?! [mind="That's almost four times the amount that I know..."/]
translation: Mosourika: 七、[p/][s/]七种？！ [mind="快是我的四倍了……"/]

original: She's learned even [i]more[/i] spells?
translation: 她还学了<u>更多</u>法术？

original: She's been picking them up rather quickly.
translation: 她的学习速度也太快了。

original: Mosourika: I've been usurped.
translation: Mosourika: 我的地位被取代了。

original: Mosourika: Look at you, Mr. Big Shot.[p/] You're wearing a suit now.[p/] And you even have a bodyguard.
translation: Mosourika: 看看你，大人物先生。[p/]你现在穿西装了，[p/]甚至还有贴身护卫。

original: Mosourika: Did you get an office job in the big city?
translation: Mosourika: 你是在城里找了个办公室工作吗？

original: Tyrion: Something like that...[p/] I'm actually a defense attorney now.
translation: Tyrion: 差不多吧……[p/]我现在实际上是个辩护律师。

original: Mosourika: A defense attorney?
translation: Mosourika: 辩护律师？

original: Mosourika: ...I see.
translation: Mosourika: ……我知道了。

original: Mosourika: Is [i]that[/i] why you left town with that scary lady?
translation: Mosourika: <u>这</u>就是你和那位可怕的女士一起离开的原因？

original: Celeste: "Scary lady"?[p/] Are you talking about Ruby?
translation: Celeste: “可怕的女士”？[p/]你指的是鲁比吗？

original: Tyrion: Ms. Tymora adopted me when my mother...[p/] passed several years ago.
translation: Tyrion: 泰摩拉女士收养了我……[p/]在我母亲多年前去世的时候。

original: Tyrion: After that, she began training me to become an attorney like her.
translation: Tyrion: 在那之后，她开始训练我成为一名像她那样的律师。

original: Mosourika: ...
translation: Mosourika: ……

original: Celeste: Wait,[p/] you've been studying to be an attorney since you were a kid?
translation: Celeste: 等等，[p/]你小时候就开始学习当律师了吗？

original: Celeste: ...Well, I guess that explains why you're so young for a lawyer.
translation: Celeste: ……嗯，我想这就是为什么你是个如此年轻的律师。

original: Tyrion: ...Said the nineteen-year-old mercenary.
translation: Tyrion: ……这句话还是十九岁的雇佣兵说的。

original: Celeste: Yeah, I guess you’ve got me there.
translation: Celeste: 是啊，你说得对。

original: Tyrion: Are you the owner of this café, Rika?
translation: Tyrion: 你是这间咖啡馆的所有者吗，里卡？

original: Tyrion: You always spoke about opening one when we were kids.
translation: Tyrion: 我们还小的时候你一直想开一间。

original: Mosourika: Yep,[p/] and it's all thanks to the Dracogen Trading Company.
translation: Mosourika: 是的，[p/]而这一切都要感谢德拉科根贸易公司。

original: Mosourika: The company's owner invested in my business idea after trying my food.
translation: Mosourika: 公司老板尝过我的食物后，投资了我的生意。

original: Mosourika: Because of him,[p/] I was able to open up here.[p/] Just like I've always dreamed.
translation: Mosourika: 因为他，[p/]我才能够在这开咖啡馆。[p/]就像我一直梦想的那样。

original: Celeste: "Dracogen Trading Company"?[p/] I don't think I've heard of them.
translation: Celeste: “德拉科根贸易公司”？[p/]我还从没有听说过他们。

original: Mosourika: They're pretty small right now.[p/] And they're only operating in Aurinax.
translation: Mosourika: 他们现在还是个小公司，[p/]而且只在欧奥耐克斯运营。

original: Mosourika: But I hear that they're planning to expand their operations throughout Wyverngarde.
translation: Mosourika: 不过我听说他们准备将经营范围拓展到维文加德。

original: Celeste: But I would have thought that Lord von Sanctus would have weeded out any competition.
translation: Celeste: 我本以为冯·桑克图斯勋爵会铲除任何竞争。

original: Celeste: After all,[p/] [i]he[/i] owns one of the largest businesses in the kingdom.
translation: Celeste: 毕竟，[p/]<u>他</u>拥有着王国里最大的商业帝国之一。

original: Tyrion: "Lord von Sanctus"...?[p/] Isn't he that pompous noble that I beat in the chess tournament this morning?
translation: Tyrion: “冯·桑克图斯勋爵”……？[p/]他不是今天早上国际象棋比赛中败给我的那个傲慢贵族吗？

original: Mosourika: Wait...[p/][s/] That was you?!
translation: Mosourika: 什么……[p/][s/]是你打败的？！

original: Tyrion: I didn't even know he [i]was[/i] a businessman.
translation: Tyrion: 我都不知道他<u>是</u>一个商人。

original: Celeste: Von Sanctus Industries invented those Arcane Constructs that we saw at the Imperial Academy.
translation: Celeste: 冯·桑克图斯工业发明了那些我们在帝国学院看见的奥术构造体。

original: Celeste: How do you not know about these things?[p/] You practically fight against nobles for a living.
translation: Celeste: 你怎么会不知道这些东西？[p/]你可是靠和贵族打官司谋生的。

original: Maybe you should start reading more about national politics.
translation: 或许你应该多读一点国家政治的东西。

original: Tyrion: Is it just me,[p/] or does the city look less...[p/] depressing than before?
translation: Tyrion: 只是我，[p/]还是这个城市……[p/]没有以前那么压抑了呢？

original: Mosourika: Oh, right.[p/] You left the city [i]before[/i] the new merchants appeared.
translation: Mosourika: 噢，对了。[p/]你在那群新商人出现[i]之前[/i]就离开了这里。

original: Tyrion: "New merchants"?[p/] Like from a merchant's guild?
translation: Tyrion: “新商人”？[p/]像是商人公会的成员？

original: Mosourika: Yeah,[p/] the Dracogen Trading Company was one of the first ones.
translation: Mosourika: 是的，[p/]德拉科根贸易公司就是第一批中的一个。

original: Mosourika: They started operating here and bought the Arcane Refinery a few years ago.
translation: Mosourika: 他们开始在这里经营，几年前买下了奥术炼油厂。

original: Mosourika: After that,[p/] merchants from all over Wyverngarde started coming here.
translation: Mosourika: 在那之后，[p/]维文加德各地的商人都开始前往这里。

original: Celeste: Well,[p/] being based in a port city would definitely give them an edge.
translation: Celeste: 嗯，[p/]在港口城市设立基地肯定会给他们带来优势。

original: Mosourika: And their presence has really helped the city's economy.
translation: Mosourika: 他们的出现还帮助了城市的经济发展。

original: Mosourika: They aren't owned by the nobility.[p/] [i]And[/i] they pay their employees a lot more than von Sanctus does.
translation: Mosourika: 他们不为贵族所有。[p/]<u>而且</u>他们给员工的工资比冯·桑克图斯高出许多。

original: Mosourika: It's really improved the quality of life for the people here.
translation: Mosourika: 这大大改善了这里人民的生活质量。

original: Celeste: I doubt von Sanctus appreciates the competition, though...
translation: Celeste: 只是我很怀疑冯·桑克图斯愿意竞争……

original: Mosourika: There's even talk about forming employee-run unions.
translation: Mosourika: 甚至还有关于成立员工主导的工会的讨论。

original: Celeste: Oh...[p/] von Sanctus definitely won't appreciate [i]that[/i].
translation: Celeste: 噢……[p/]冯·桑克图斯肯定不会喜欢<u>那样</u>的。

original: Mosourika: So...[p/] You still play chess?
translation: Mosourika: 所以……[p/]你还下棋吗？

original: Tyrion: Yeah,[p/] I'm nationally ranked too.
translation: Tyrion: 是，[p/]我还有全国排名。

original: Mosourika: I heard that an "upstart commoner" defeated Lord von Sanctus at a tournament this morning.
translation: Mosourika: 我听说一位“新手平民”在今早的锦标赛中击败了冯·桑克图斯勋爵。

original: Mosourika: But I had no idea they were talking about you.
translation: Mosourika: 但是我不知道他们说的是你。

original: Tyrion: ..."U-[p/]Upstart commoner"?
translation: Tyrion: ……“新、[p/]新手平民”？

original: Celeste: Pfft...[p/] The name suits you, Tyrion.
translation: Celeste: 哈哈……[p/]这个名字很适合你呢，提利昂。

original: Mosourika: ...Hey,[p/] do you still do that thing when you play?
translation: Mosourika: ……嘿，[p/]你下棋时还会做那件事吗？

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Tyrion: ...No.
translation: Tyrion: ……不会。

original: Celeste: What "thing"?
translation: Celeste: 什么“事”？

original: Tyrion: Nothing...[p/] She's not talking about anything.
translation: Tyrion: 没什么……[p/]她什么也没说。

original: Mosourika: Wait...[p/] You're [i]actually[/i] embarrassed about it?
translation: Mosourika: 等等……[p/]你<u>实际上</u>对那件事感觉很害羞？

original: Mosourika: When we were kids,[p/] you did it even more than [i]I[/i] did!
translation: Mosourika: 在我们小时候，[p/]你干的可比[i]我[/i]还多！

original: Celeste: What?![p/][s/] What did he use to do?!
translation: Celeste: 什么？！[p/][s/]他以前都在干什么？！

original: Mosourika: Why don't you show her, Tyrion?
translation: Mosourika: 你为何不展示给她看一下，提利昂？

original: Tyrion: I'd...[p/] rather not.
translation: Tyrion: 我……[p/]还是算了吧。

original: Celeste: Come on![p/][s/] Show us, Tyrion!
translation: Celeste: 拜托！[p/][s/]给我们看看嘛，提利昂！

original: Tyrion: I think I'm a little too old for this...
translation: Tyrion: 我这么大年龄的人不太合适……

original: Mosourika: You're never too old to tap into your inner Chuuni!
translation: Mosourika: 你永远不会老到无法释放你内心的中二之魂！

original: Mosourika: Do it, Tyrion!
translation: Mosourika: 来吧，提利昂！

original: Celeste: Yeah![p/][s/] Do it!
translation: Celeste: 嘿！[p/][s/]来吧！

original: The two of them begin chanting,[p/] trying to pressure you.
translation: 她们俩开始起哄，[p/]想要强迫你做。

original: It draws the attention of the other patrons in the café.
translation: 甚至把咖啡馆里其他顾客的注意力都吸引过来了。

original: They don't seem to care about the confused looks that they're getting.
translation: 她们俩看起来并不在乎那些顾客脸上投来的疑惑的视线。

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: It seems that you don't have a choice.
translation: 看来你没有别的选择了。

original: You take in a deep breath.
translation: 你深吸一口气。

original: Tyrion: Those who stand in the shadows![p/][s/] Those who fear the light of divinity!
translation: Tyrion: 那些隐藏在阴影中的人！[p/][s/]那些畏惧神圣光辉的人！

original: Tyrion: Your imperials will fall,[p/] and your armies will perish!
translation: Tyrion: 你的帝国将崩塌，[p/]你的军队将覆灭！

original: Tyrion: Kneel and cower before the divine gaze of the Eye of Horus!
translation: Tyrion: 在荷鲁斯之眼的神圣凝视下，跪下颤抖吧！

original: Mosourika: ...
translation: Mosourika: ……

original: Celeste: ...
translation: Celeste: ……

original: Celeste: Pffft...
translation: Celeste: 哈哈哈哈……

original: Mosourika: *snicker*
translation: Mosourika: *偷笑*

original: They're trying their hardest to contain their laughter.
translation: 她们努力憋着不笑出来。

original: Tyrion: …W-[p/]Well,[p/][s/] [i]that's[/i] why I don't do it anymore!
translation: Tyrion: …呃、[p/]嗯，[p/][s/]<u>这就是</u>为什么我不干了的原因！

original: Celeste: N-[p/]No...[p/] T-[p/]That was...[p/] great.[p/]
translation: Celeste: 不、[p/]不……[p/]这、[p/]这真的……[p/]很棒[p/]

original: Celeste: It was [i]really[/i] cool, Tyrion.
translation: Celeste: 这真的<u>太</u>酷了，提利昂。

original: Her poorly contained laughs are coming out between each word.
translation: 她的笑声难以抑制，每个词之间都夹杂着笑声。

original: Tyrion: And why are [i]you[/i] laughing?![p/][s/] You were [i]just[/i] doing it a moment ago!
translation: Tyrion: <u>你</u>为什么要笑？！[p/][s/]<u>仅仅</u>几分钟前你也在干这种事！

original: Celeste: Yeah...[p/] But she owns it.
translation: Celeste: 是……[p/]但她很难不笑。

original: Tyrion: Ugh...
translation: Tyrion: 呃……

original: Mosourika: You used to say something else before, too...
translation: Mosourika: 你以前也常说差不多的东西……

original: Mosourika: "I won't let anyone stand in my way.[p/] Even if they're-"
translation: Mosourika: “无人能阻挡我的道路。[p/]即使他们是——”

original: Celeste: -A man,[p/] king,[p/] or god?
translation: Celeste: ——人、[p/]王、[p/]亦或是神？

original: Mosourika: Yeah![p/] [i]That's[/i] it!
translation: Mosourika: 是的！[p/][i]就是[/i]这个！

original: Celeste: He still says that sometimes!
translation: Celeste: 他现在有时也那么说！

original: Mosourika: So...[p/] Are you going to introduce us?
translation: Mosourika: 所以……[p/]你会介绍我们吗？

original: Tyrion: Right...
translation: Tyrion: 对……

original: Tyrion: Rika, this is Celeste McCoy, my...[p/] bodyguard.
translation: Tyrion: 里卡，这位是塞莱斯特·麦考伊，我的……[p/]贴身护卫。

original: Mosourika: ...Bodyguard?
translation: Mosourika: ……贴身护卫？

original: Tyrion: And Celeste, this is-
translation: Tyrion: 塞莱斯特，这位是——

original: Mosourika: Ha![p/][s/] As if I need such introductions!
translation: Mosourika: 哈！[p/][s/]我就不用这样介绍了！

original: Mosourika: [i]I[/i] am Mosourika Tudor:[p/][s/] Dark Lord of Aurinax,[p/][s/] High Archmagi of the Cadmium Flames,[p/][s/] and the proud proprietor of this café!
translation: Mosourika: <u>我</u>是莫苏里卡·都铎：[p/][s/]欧奥耐克斯的黑暗领主，[p/][s/]镉之火焰的最高大法师，[p/][s/]以及这家咖啡馆的骄傲的店主！

original: Celeste: O-[p/]Oh...[p/] Okay.
translation: Celeste: 噢、[p/]噢……[p/]好的。

original: Tyrion: I was friends with her when I used to live here.
translation: Tyrion: 我以前住在这里的时候和她是朋友。

original: Tyrion: She's a little eccentric,[p/] but she's a good person at heart.
translation: Tyrion: 她有点古怪，[p/]但她本性善良。

original: Mosourika: H-[p/][s/]Hey!
translation: Mosourika: 嘿-[p/][s/]嘿！

original: Tyrion: She's also a commonfolk mage like you.
translation: Tyrion: 她也是个和你一样的平民法师。

original: Mosourika: Ah![p/] So you're also a practitioner of the Arcane Arts.
translation: Mosourika: 啊！[p/]所以你也是奥术实践者。

original: Mosourika: Which spells have you mastered?
translation: Mosourika: 你现在掌握了什么法术？

original: Celeste: Hm...[p/] I haven't really [i]mastered[/i] any of them.
translation: Celeste: 唔……[p/]我还没有[i]掌握[/i]任何法术。

original: Celeste: I know about seven spells, though.
translation: Celeste: 不过我能用的有七种。

original: Mosourika: S-[p/][s/]Seven?! [mind="That's almost four times the amount as mine..."]
translation: Mosourika: 七、[p/][s/]七种？！ [mind="快是我的四倍了……"/]

original: She's learned even more spells?
translation: 她还学了更多法术？

original: She's been picking them up rather quickly.
translation: 她的学习速度也太快了。

original: Mosourika: I've been usurped.
translation: Mosourika: 我的地位被取代了。

original: Mosourika: Look at you, Mr. Big Shot.[p/] You're wearing a suit now.[p/] And you even have a bodyguard.
translation: Mosourika: 看看你，大人物先生。[p/]你现在穿西装了，[p/]甚至还有贴身护卫。

original: Mosourika: Did you get an office job in the big city?
translation: Mosourika: 你是在城里找了个办公室工作吗？

original: Tyrion: Something like that...[p/] I'm actually a defense attorney now.
translation: Tyrion: 差不多吧……[p/]我现在实际上是个辩护律师。

original: Mosourika: A defense attorney?
translation: Mosourika: 辩护律师？

original: Mosourika: ...I see.
translation: Mosourika: ……我知道了。

original: Mosourika: Is [i]that[/i] why you left town with that scary lady?
translation: Mosourika: <u>这</u>就是你和那位可怕的女士一起离开的原因？

original: Celeste: "Scary lady"?[p/] Are you talking about Ruby?
translation: Celeste: “可怕的女士”？[p/]你指的是鲁比吗？

original: Tyrion: Ms. Tymora adopted me when my mother...[p/] passed several years ago.
translation: Tyrion: 泰摩拉女士收养了我……[p/]在我母亲多年前去世的时候。

original: Tyrion: After that,[p/] she started training me to become an attorney like her.
translation: Tyrion: 在那之后，她开始训练我成为一名像她那样的律师。

original: Mosourika: ...
translation: Mosourika: ……

original: Celeste: Wait,[p/] you've been studying to be an attorney since you were a kid?
translation: Celeste: 等等，[p/]你小时候就开始学习当律师了吗？

original: Celeste: ...Well, I guess that explains why you're so young for a lawyer.
translation: Celeste: ……嗯，我想这就是为什么你是个如此年轻的律师。

original: Tyrion: ...Said the nineteen-year-old mercenary.
translation: Tyrion: ……这句话还是十九岁的雇佣兵说的。

original: Celeste: Eh, I guess you've got me there.
translation: Celeste: 是啊，你说得对。

original: Tyrion: You've really made a life for yourself here.
translation: Tyrion: 你还是在这里找到了自己的生活。

original: Tyrion: I'm glad that you were able to realize your dreams and open a café.
translation: Tyrion: 我很高兴你实现了自己的梦想，开了一家咖啡厅。

original: Mosourika: Hehe.[p/] But of course.
translation: Mosourika: 哈哈，[p/]那当然。

original: Mosourika: Once the Dark Lord sets her sights on a quarry,[p/] it's only a matter of time before she obtains it.
translation: Mosourika: 一旦黑暗领主锁定了她的猎物，[p/]抓住它就只是时间问题了。

original: Mosourika: I've grown up since you last saw me.
translation: Mosourika: 自从你上次见到我以来，我已经长大了。

original: Tyrion: Yeah...[p/] Let's not go [i]that[/i] far.
translation: Tyrion: 是……[p/]我们还是不要扯<u>那么</u>远了。

original: Mosourika: What's [i]that[/i] supposed to mean?!
translation: Mosourika: <u>这是</u>什么意思？！

original: Mosourika: The scary lady...[p/] She's your mother now?
translation: Mosourika: 那个可怕的女士……[p/]她现在是你的母亲吗？

original: Tyrion: …She's my guardian, yes.
translation: Tyrion: ……是，她是我的监护人。

original: Mosourika: ...Is she nice?
translation: Mosourika: ……她人怎么样？好相处吗？

original: Tyrion: "Nice" isn't the [i]first[/i] word I'd use to describe Ms. Tymora...
translation: Tyrion: “好相处”恐怕不是我形容提摩拉女士时会想到的第一个词……

original: Tyrion: But she's always taken care of me.
translation: Tyrion: 但她一直在照顾我。

original: Tyrion: She taught me everything I know about being a defense attorney.
translation: Tyrion: 关于如何当一名辩护律师，她教会了我所有的一切。

original: Tyrion: I don't think I'd be the person that I am today without her.
translation: Tyrion: 若不是她，我无法成为今天的我。

original: Mosourika: That's good.
translation: Mosourika: 真好。

original: Mosourika: I'm just glad that she treats you well.
translation: Mosourika: 我很高兴她对你不错。

original: Tyrion: What do you think about [i]this[/i], Rika?
translation: Tyrion: 你怎么看待<u>这个</u>的，里卡?

original: Mosourika: Speaking about such things would be beneath me.
translation: Mosourika: 谈论这种事情有失我的身份。

original: In other words,[p/] she has nothing to say about it.
translation: 也就是说，[p/]她无可奉告。

original: Mosourika: Oh![p/] Looks like our order is here.
translation: Mosourika: 噢！[p/]我们点的单来了。

original: A waiter brings in the lunch special for each of you.
translation: 一名服务员为你们每个人端上了今日特餐。

original: The enticing aroma of the meals makes you salivate a little.
translation: 食物的诱人香味让你垂涎欲滴。

original: You gladly devour the meal.[p/] Rika's cooking is just as delicious as you remembered.
translation: 你愉快地享用着这顿美餐。[p/]里卡的厨艺和你记忆中的一样美味。

original: You spend some more time catching up with her while you finish your meal.
translation: 你一边吃完这顿饭，一边和她聊起了更多近况。

original: As your conversation continues,[p/] You and Celeste regale her with stories of your past court cases.
translation: 随着谈话的继续，[p/]你和塞莱斯特给她讲述了你们过去一些法庭案件的趣事。

original: Mosourika: No![p/][s/] Really?!
translation: Mosourika: 不！[p/][s/]不会吧？！

original: Celeste: Yep![p/] It turned out that it was the [i]headmaster[/i] the entire time.
translation: Celeste: 是的！[p/]最后发现一直都是<u>校长</u>。

original: Mosourika: Wow...[p/] I would have never figured that out.
translation: Mosourika: 哇……[p/]我绝对发现不了。

original: Mosourika: How did you know, Tyrion?
translation: Mosourika: 你怎么知道的，提利昂？

original: Celeste: Maybe he "saw" it with his Eye of Horus.
translation: Celeste: 可能他用自己的荷鲁斯之眼“看见”了。

original: You nearly choke on your drink before you realize what she's actually referring to.
translation: 你意识到她真正指的是什么，差点就被自己的饮料呛到。

original: Mosourika: But wow…[p/] I can't believe it.
translation: Mosourika: 但是……[p/]难以置信。

original: Mosourika: I never thought court cases could be that dramatic.
translation: Mosourika: 我不知道法庭案件还会这样戏剧化。

original: You finish your meal as you continue to tell Rika more about your cases.
translation: 你一边说着更多案件的故事，一边吃完了这顿饭。

original: It's…[p/] nice being able to talk with her again.
translation: 能够再次跟她聊天……[p/]真是太棒了。

original: You tried so hard to leave everything behind after what happened.
translation: 在发生了这么多事后，你竭尽全力把一切都抛之脑后。

original: But you're happy that she seems to be doing well.
translation: 但是你很高兴看见她现在过得这么好。

original: Celeste: ...
translation: Celeste: ……

original: Celeste: Hey, Tyrion?
translation: Celeste: 嘿，提利昂？

original: Tyrion: ...Yeah?
translation: Tyrion: ……是？

original: Celeste: Back at the house...[p/] What was that all about?
translation: Celeste: 刚才在房子里……[p/]到底是怎么回事？

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Celeste: I've never seen you get that angry before.
translation: Celeste: 我从没见过你那么生气。

original: Celeste: And you said that it was [i]your[/i] house...
translation: Celeste: 而且你说那是<u>你的</u>房子……

original: Tyrion: ...Yeah.[p/] It was my house.
translation: Tyrion: ……是。[p/]那曾经是我的房子。

original: Celeste: It "was"?
translation: Celeste: “曾经是”？

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Celeste: Ever since we arrived in this city,[p/] you've haven't really been...[p/] yourself.
translation: Celeste: 塞莱斯特：自从我们来到这座城市后，[p/]你就一直……不像你自己了。

original: Celeste: If you want to talk about it,[p/] I-
translation: Celeste: 如果你想说说这件事，[p/]我——

original: Tyrion: I'm fine.[p/] And I [i]don't[/i][p/] want to talk about it.
translation: Tyrion: 我很好。[p/]而且我<u>不</u>[p/]想谈论这件事。

original: Celeste: ...
translation: Celeste: ……

original: Celeste: You're [i]not[/i] fine.[p/][s/] I can see it on your face.
translation: Celeste: 你一点也<u>不</u>好。[p/][s/]我能从你脸上看出来。

original: Celeste: Please.[p/] Just talk to me.
translation: Celeste: 拜托了，[p/]告诉我吧。

original: Tyrion: It's [i]none[/i] of your business!
translation: Tyrion: 这跟你<u>没有</u>关系！

original: That came out a lot louder than you wanted it to.
translation: 这句话说得比你想的要大声得多。

original: Tyrion: C-[p/]Celeste...[p/] I'm sorry...[p/] I didn't mean to-
translation: Tyrion: 塞、[p/]塞莱斯特……[p/]对不起……[p/]我不是故意——

original: Without a word,[p/] she quickly walks ahead of you.
translation: 她什么也没说，[p/]快步向你走来。

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Judge: Court is now resumed for the trial of Stefanic Dracogen.
translation: Judge: 法庭现在开庭，就斯蒂芬尼克·德拉科根一案继续审理。

original: Judge: Let us review the proceedings from two days ago.
translation: Judge: 我们先就两日前的诉讼情况进行回顾。

original: Judge: At first,[p/] the facts of the case seemed very straightforward.
translation: Judge: 起初，[p/]这个案件的事实看起来非常简单明了。

original: Judge: The victim:[p/] Justin Waye,[p/] put his weight on a poorly maintained guard rail on the refinery grounds.
translation: Judge: 受害者：[p/]贾斯汀·维耶，[p/]在炼油厂场地内将体重压在了一处维护不善的护栏上。

original: Judge: Said guard rail broke,[p/] causing Justin Waye to fall to his death.
translation: Judge: 那处护栏断裂，[p/]导致贾斯汀·维耶坠落身亡。

original: Judge: ...However,[p/] the defense presented a shocking piece of evidence in the previous proceedings.
translation: Judge: ……然而，[p/]辩方在之前的庭审中出示了一份令人震惊的证据。

original: Judge: Traces of [b]transmutation[/b] magic were found on that same broken guard rail.
translation: Judge: 在同样的护栏断裂处，还发现了形变术的魔法痕迹。

original: Judge: This new evidence implies that sabotage,[p/] if not outright foul play,[p/] played a part in the death of the victim.
translation: Judge: 这一新证据表明，[p/]受害者的死亡可能涉及人为破坏，甚至是蓄意谋害。

original: Judge: This evidence is also accompanied by conflicting testimonies from witnesses.
translation: Judge: 这份证据还伴随着证人们互相矛盾的证词。

original: Judge: All of these elements have thrown quite some doubt on the validity of the prosecution's case.
translation: Judge: 所有这些因素都给了检方案件的可信度沉重打击。

original: Aria: Yes.[p/] However,[p/] the prosecution maintains that the Dracogen Trading Company is at fault for Justin Waye's death.
translation: Aria: 是的。[p/]但是，[p/]检方坚持认为，是德拉科根贸易公司对贾斯汀·维耶的死亡负有责任。

original: Judge: Even though someone may have sabotaged the guard rails?
translation: Judge: 即使有人可能破坏了护栏？

original: Aria: The prosecution acknowledges that sabotage [i]may[/i] have occurred at the scene of the accident.
translation: Aria: 检方承认事故现场<u>可能</u>被人为破坏过。

original: Aria: However,[p/] we also believe that there are several factors in this case that the court is overlooking.
translation: Aria: 然而，[p/]我们也认为本案中有几个因素被法庭忽视了。

original: Aria: As we all know,[p/] several witnesses were present at the refinery at the time of the accident.
translation: Aria: “众所周知，[p/]事故发生时，有几名证人在炼油厂现场。”

original: Aria: The harbourmaster was showing a patron around the refinery.
translation: Aria: 当时，港务长正在带领一位赞助商参观炼油厂。

original: Aria: Mosourika Tudor was making a food delivery and entered the building.
translation: Aria: 莫苏里卡·都铎正在进行食品配送，并进入了炼油厂。

original: Aria: And of course,[p/] the victim:[p/] Justin Waye was obviously present as well.
translation: Aria: 当然，[p/]受害者：[p/]贾斯汀·维耶显然也在场。

original: Aria: Each and every one of these people had no business [i]being[/i] in the refinery that night.
translation: Aria: 每一个在场的人，那晚都没有理由<u>出现在</u>炼油厂。

original: Tyrion: In the case of the harbourmaster and his patron,[p/] it would be hardly reasonable for [i]anyone[/i] to stop them.
translation: Tyrion: 至于港务长和他的顾客，[p/]几乎<u>没有人</u>会认为阻止他们是合理的。

original: You doubt anyone would stand in the way of the crown prince.
translation: 你怀疑会有人敢阻碍王储殿下的去路。

original: Aria: ...That may be.[p/] But [i]Justin Waye[/i] worked in the freight division and should [i]not[/i] have been at the scene.
translation: Aria: ……这可能是事实。[p/]但<u>贾斯汀·维耶</u>在货运部门工作，他<u>本不应该</u>出现在现场。

original: Tyrion: I've already verified this with my client.
translation: Tyrion: 我已经和我的委托人核实过这一点。

original: Tyrion: The victim was not authorized to be in the refinery building.
translation: Tyrion: 受害者没有获得进入炼油厂的授权。

original: Aria: And who stopped Justin Waye from entering the area unauthorized?
translation: Aria: 那是谁阻止了贾斯汀·维耶未经授权进入该区域？

original: Aria: Isn't it the defendant's duty to prevent such individuals from entering the building?
translation: Aria: 阻止此类人员进入炼油厂难道不是被告的责任吗？

original: Tyrion: My client can't be held responsible for Justin's breach of the set protocols.
translation: Tyrion: 我的委托人不能为贾斯汀违反既定规定的行为负责。

original: Tyrion: And you surely can't hold my client responsible for someone [i]sabotaging[/i] the guard rail.
translation: Tyrion: 你当然不能让我的委托人对<u>破坏</u>护栏这件事负责。

original: Aria: This so-called "sabotage" is only theoretical until a proper culprit is found.
translation: Aria: 所谓的“破坏”在没有找到真正的罪犯之前，充其量只是一个假设。

original: Judge: Hm...[p/] I might be compelled to agree with you, Ms. Steelwind.
translation: Judge: 嗯……[p/]斯蒂尔文德女士，我或许不得不同意你的观点。

original: Judge: After all,[p/] there's no hard evidence that proves the traces of [b]transmutation[/b] were left by a specific spell.
translation: Judge: 毕竟，[p/]并没有确凿的证据证明这些[b]形变术[/b]的痕迹是由某个特定的法术留下的。

original: Celeste: What kind of mental gymnastics is that?!
translation: Celeste: 这是什么头脑体操？！

original: Celeste: Every part of the guard rail that had traces on it was rusted!
translation: Celeste: 护栏上所有有魔法痕迹的部分都是生锈的！

original: Tyrion: Ugh...[p/] They're bending the context of what happened to suit their purposes.
translation: Tyrion: 呃……[p/]他们在扭曲事件的背景以迎合自己的目的。

original: Hard evidence means everything here...[p/] And the Rod of Mending has been reduced to shards in the vat...
translation: 确凿的证据在这里至关重要……[p/]而修复之杖已经在桶里碎成了片段……

original: Without the complete rod,[p/] you can't prove that someone used it to sabotage the guard rail.
translation: 没有完整的修复之杖，[p/]你无法证明有人用它破坏了护栏。

original: Aria: Regardless,[p/] is it not the responsibility of the Dracogen Trading Company to ensure that its employees do not wander into restricted areas?
translation: Aria: 无论如何，[p/]难道确保其员工不会擅自进入禁区不是德拉科根贸易公司的责任吗？

original: Aria: Blaming a potential saboteur puts the cart before the horse.
translation: Aria: 把责任推到可能的破坏者身上，是本末倒置。

original: Aria: It doesn't just stop with Justin Waye either.
translation: Aria: 这不仅仅止于贾斯汀·维耶的情况。

original: Aria: Why was [i]Mosourika Tudor[/i] able to enter the building?
translation: Aria: 为什么<u>莫苏里卡·都铎</u>能够进入炼油厂？

original: Aria: She doesn't even work for the refinery,[p/] yet she was able to waltz into the building without any trouble.
translation: Aria: 她甚至不是炼油厂的员工，[p/]却能毫无阻碍地进入大楼。

original: Actually,[p/] Steelwind [i]does[/i] have a point about Rika.
translation: 实际上，[p/]斯蒂尔文德关于里卡的观点<u>确实</u>有道理。

original: Shouldn't something have stopped her from entering that area?
translation: 难道不应该有什么措施阻止她进入那个区域吗？

original: You doubt that Dracogen would show that kind of negligence.
translation: 你怀疑德拉科根会表现出这种疏忽大意。

original: Tyrion: If that's true,[p/] I believe that we should hear from Ms. Tudor directly.
translation: Tyrion: 如果那是真的，[p/]我认为我们应该直接听听都铎女士的陈述。

original: Tyrion: Let's hear how "easily" she gained access to the refinery on the day of the accident.
translation: Tyrion: 让我们听听她是如何在事故当天“轻松”进入炼油厂的。

original: Aria: We've already anticipated that.
translation: Aria: 我们早就料到了。

original: Aria: Mosourika Tudor is prepared and ready to testify.
translation: Aria: 莫苏里卡·都铎已准备好作证。

original: Judge: Very well, then.
translation: Judge: 很好，那么。

original: Judge: Bailiff,[p/] please escort Ms. Tudor to the stand.
translation: Judge: 法警，[p/]请护送都铎小姐到证人席。

original: Aria: Ms. Tudor,[p/] are you aware of why you've been called here today?
translation: Aria: 都铎女士，[p/]你知道今天为何被召来吗？

original: Mosourika: Y-[p/]Yeah...[p/] I heard everything from the gallery.
translation: Mosourika: 我……[p/]是的……[p/]我从旁听席听到了所有的事情。

original: Aria: Then you'll have no problem answering the following question.
translation: Aria: 那你应该不会有问题回答接下来的问题。

original: Aria: Did you encounter resistance when you entered the refinery the night of the accident?
translation: Aria: 在事故发生的那个晚上，你进入炼油厂时遇到了阻碍吗？

original: Mosourika: ...
translation: Mosourika: ……

original: Aria: Witness,[p/] may I remind you that you are under oath to tell the court everything that you know.
translation: Aria: 证人，[p/]请允许我提醒，你已宣誓过要向法庭如实陈述您所知道的一切。

original: Aria: Failure to do so is a crime.
translation: Aria: 知而不言即是犯罪。

original: Mosourika: Urk!
translation: Mosourika: 噫！

original: Mosourika: N-[p/]No...[p/] No one tried to stop me.
translation: Mosourika: 没、[p/]没有……[p/]没有人阻止我。

original: Mosourika: S-[p/]Sorry, Tyrion...
translation: Mosourika: 抱[p/]抱歉，提利昂……

original: Aria: You have nothing to apologize for, witness.
translation: Aria: 你没什么好道歉的，证人。

original: Aria: The only one at fault is the Dracogen Trading Company and their negligence.
translation: Aria: 有责任的只有德拉科根贸易公司和它们的疏忽大意。

original: Mosourika: H-[p/][s/]Hey![p/][s/] That's-!
translation: Mosourika: 嘿、[p/][s/]嘿！[p/][s/]那是——！

original: Aria: For the record,[p/] please testify in detail about how you entered the refinery that day, Ms. Tudor.
translation: Aria: 为了记录，[p/]请详细作证，你当天是如何进入炼油厂的，都铎女士。

original: Mosourika: Okay...
translation: Mosourika: 好的……

original: Mosourika: That day,[p/] I was looking for Justin in the freight area.[p/] But I couldn't find him.
translation: Mosourika: 那天，[p/]我在货运区找贾斯汀，[p/]但我找不到他。

original: Mosourika: I decided to look for him in the refinery's main building.
translation: Mosourika: 于是我决定去炼油厂的主楼找他。

original: Mosourika: There was some kind of magical door leading into it,[p/] but it was unlocked.
translation: Mosourika: 有一道通往大楼的魔法门，[p/]但它没有上锁。

original: Mosourika: Nothing really stopped me from entering the refinery building.
translation: Mosourika: 确实没有什么阻碍我进入炼油厂。

original: Aria: As the court can clearly see,[p/] there were no safeguards preventing the witness from entering that restricted area.
translation: Aria: 正如法庭清晰所见，[p/]没有任何防护措施阻止证人进入那个限制区域。

original: Tyrion: The witness clearly stated that there was a magical door leading into the building.
translation: Tyrion: 证人明确表示，的确有一道魔法门通往大楼。

original: Tyrion: This was obviously some sort of security door powered by artificery.
translation: Tyrion: 这显然是一种由奥术能源驱动的安全门。

original: Aria: ...Which was still unlocked and effectively useless.
translation: Aria: ……但它依然没有上锁，实际上毫无作用。

original: Damn it...[p/] There must be a way to prove that the unlocked door wasn't Dracogen's fault.
translation: 该死……[p/]一定有办法证明那扇没有上锁的门不是德拉科根公司的错。

original: Judge: Mr. Cuthbert,[p/] you may begin your cross-examination.
translation: Judge: 卡斯伯特先生，[p/]你可以开始交叉询问了。

original: Tyrion: You were there to deliver his dinner to him.[p/] Am I correct?
translation: Tyrion: 你是过去给他送晚餐的，[p/]我没说错吧？

original: Mosourika: Yeah...[p/] He was usually in the freight area around that time.
translation: Mosourika: 是的……[p/]那个时间点他一般都在货运区。

original: Mosourika: I was surprised when I didn't see him there.
translation: Mosourika: 我很惊讶我没在那看到他。

original: Mosourika: I was a little worried so...
translation: Mosourika: 我有点担心，于是……

original: Tyrion: It seems strange that you'd go looking for him.
translation: Tyrion: 这有点奇怪啊，你还会去找他。

original: Tyrion: Why not just leave his food with one of his co-workers?
translation: Tyrion: 为什么不把食物托付给他的同事呢？

original: Mosourika: I thought of that,[p/] but I also wanted to make sure that he was okay.
translation: Mosourika: 我有这么想过，[p/]但我希望亲自确认他没事。

original: Mosourika: I [i]was[/i] the one that helped him get this job in the first place.
translation: Mosourika: 毕竟一开始<u>是</u>我帮他找的这个工作。

original: Mosourika: It wouldn't look good if he left in the middle of a shift.
translation: Mosourika: 如果他在上班中途离开，还是不太合适。

original: Aria: How [i]did[/i] you enter the Refinery Building, Ms. Tudor?
translation: Aria: 那你是<u>怎么</u>进入炼油厂的，都铎女士？

original: Tyrion: By "magical door",[p/] do you mean that it was a door powered by artificery?
translation: Tyrion: 你说“魔法门”，[p/]是指那是由奥术能源供应的门吗？

original: Mosourika: Yeah...[p/] I have a door like it in my restaurant too.
translation: Mosourika: 是……[p/]我的咖啡馆里也有一扇差不多的门。

original: Mosourika: But this one looked a lot more complex.
translation: Mosourika: 但大楼的这一扇看起来更复杂。

original: Tyrion: Why would you or Dracogen need magical doors, anyways?
translation: Tyrion: 为什么你和德拉科根公司需要魔法门？

original: Mosourika: The one in my café magically locks the shop when I close it for the day.
translation: Mosourika: 我咖啡馆里的那扇会在我打烊时魔法般锁上。

original: Mosourika: I guess the door to the refinery building was for the same thing.
translation: Mosourika: 我猜通往炼油厂建筑的那扇门也是一样的作用。

original: Tyrion: But that means that there [i]was[/i] a mechanism to keep out unauthorized personnel.
translation: Tyrion: 但那就意味着<u>存在</u>某种机制，能阻挡未获授权的人进入。

original: Aria: ...Which was effectively useless.
translation: Aria: ……而且毫无作用。

original: Aria: The witness entered the refinery and encountered zero resistance.
translation: Aria: 证人进入炼油厂时，没有遇到任何阻碍。

original: Aria: Furthermore,[p/] the Inquisition has already logged the specs for the door.
translation: Aria: 此外，[p/]裁判所已经记录了这扇门的详细规格。

original: Aria: Did you use a key to unlock the door, Ms. Tudor?
translation: Aria: 你是用钥匙开门的吗，都铎女士？

original: Mosourika: No...[p/] I didn't...
translation: Mosourika: 不……[p/]不是……

original: Aria: As you can see from this report,[p/] Stefanic Dracogen was the only person capable of disabling the lock.
translation: Aria: 正如你从这份报告中所见，斯蒂芬尼克·德拉科根是唯一能让门锁失效的人。

original: Mosourika: I guess Mr. Dracogen kept the door unlocked during work hours...
translation: Mosourika: 我猜德拉科根先生在上班时间还开着门……

original: Aria: This means that it's entirely Dracogen's fault that the victim gained access to the building in the first place.
translation: Aria: 这意味着，受害者能够进入炼油厂完全是德拉科根公司的过失。

original: Mosourika: W-[p/][s/]Wait![p/][s/] That's not what I meant to-!
translation: Mosourika: 等、[p/][s/]等等！[p/][s/]我不是这个意思——！

original: Aria: But that [i]is[/i] what you implied.
translation: Aria: 但这就[i]是[/i]您想表达的。

original: Aria: Unless you can prove that [i]another[/i] person disabled that door.
translation: Aria: 除非您能证明还有<u>其他</u>人破坏了那扇门。

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: You can't refute that statement...[p/] yet.
translation: 你没有办法驳斥这个观点……[p/]至少目前是的。

original: But you might be able to work with this new information.
translation: 但是你或许能在这个新信息上做文章。

original: Tyrion: Regardless,[p/] please add that last statement to your testimony, witness.
translation: Tyrion: 不管怎样，[p/]请将刚才的那句话添加到您的证词中，证人。

original: Mosourika: Alright...
translation: Mosourika: 好的……

original: Tyrion: That's quite the leap in logic.
translation: Tyrion: 这可真是个不小的逻辑跳跃。

original: Aria: The specs of the door state that the lock can only be disabled by Stefanic Dracogen.
translation: Aria: 门的规格表明，只有斯蒂芬尼克·德拉科根能让锁失效。

original: Mosourika: Sorry,[p/] but I can't think of any other reason why it would be disabled.
translation: Mosourika: 抱歉，[p/]但我想不到任何锁会失效的原因。

original: Mosourika: I mean...[p/] I get it.
translation: Mosourika: 我的意思是……[p/]我知道了。

original: Mosourika: Sometimes I forget the key to my shop.[p/] It becomes a real headache when I get locked out.
translation: Mosourika: 有时我会忘带咖啡店的钥匙。[p/]被锁在外面真令人头疼。

original: You suppose that makes sense.[p/] But would Dracogen really do something like that?
translation: 你觉得她说的话有道理。[p/]但德拉科根真的会做这样的事吗？

original: The lock is [i]designed[/i] to be disabled only by Dracogen.
translation: 锁被<u>设计</u>成只有德拉科根能使其失效。

original: But perhaps someone did something to bypass that.
translation: 但也许有人采取了某种手段绕过了这一点。

original: Tyrion: Are you sure you're not forgetting any obstacles that you encountered?
translation: Tyrion: 你确定你没有忘记什么你碰见的阻碍吗？

original: Mosourika: No...[p/] I would have remembered something like that.
translation: Mosourika: 没有……[p/]我会记得那样的东西的。

original: Mosourika: If someone told me that I wasn't supposed to be there,[p/] I would've just left.
translation: Mosourika: 如果有人告诉我那不是我该去的地方，[p/]我会离开的。

original: She seems sincere about that.
translation: 她看来对此很确定。

original: It was probably an honest mistake.
translation: 这可能是一个诚实的错误。

original: Celeste: Rika didn't even realize that she entered a restricted area.
translation: Celeste: 里卡甚至没有意识到她进入了一个限制区域。

original: Tyrion: But the fact she was able to enter it so easily is definitely strange.
translation: Tyrion: 但她能够这么轻松进入的事实太奇怪了。

original: Tyrion: Dracogen must have had precautions to prevent such a thing from happening.
translation: Tyrion: 德拉科根一定有预防措施阻止这样的事发生。

original: Celeste: Maybe the employees got lazy and disabled the lock against his orders...
translation: Celeste: 也许员工犯懒了，违背他的命令让锁失效了。

original: It's possible...[p/] But would Dracogen really allow something like that to happen?
translation: 有可能……[p/]但为什么德拉科根会让这样的事发生？

original: Tyrion: Your Honor![p/][s/] It's clear that the witness's testimony is contradictory!
translation: Tyrion: 法官阁下！[p/][s/]证人的证言明显存在矛盾！

original: Tyrion: And [i]this[/i] piece of evidence proves it!
translation: Tyrion: <u>这个</u>就是相关证据！

original: Judge: I fail to see how [i]that[/i] proves anything, Mr. Cuthbert...
translation: Judge: 卡斯伯特先生……我没看出来这两者有什么关系。

original: Tyrion: O-[p/]Oh...[p/] I guess you're right.
translation: Tyrion: 啊、[p/]哦……[p/] 好像是这样的。

original: Tyrion: Ms. Steelwind.[p/] You claim that my client expressed negligence by disabling the door.
translation: Tyrion: 斯蒂尔文德女士，[p/]你声称我的委托人因让门失效而表现出玩忽职守。

original: Tyrion: [i]This[/i] is the reason why the security door was unlocked,[p/] and why the current witness was able to enter the building.
translation: Tyrion: <u>这</u>就是为什么安全门会打开，[p/]为什么当前的证人能进入炼油厂。

original: Aria: That's correct.
translation: Aria: 对的。

original: Aria: Your client's negligence allowed unauthorized persons like Justin Waye to gain access to the building.
translation: Aria: 你的委托人的疏忽让贾斯汀·维耶这样未获授权的人能够进入炼油厂。

original: Aria: And regardless of any sabotage,[p/] Justin Waye died because he was in said unauthorized area.
translation: Aria: 而且无论发生了什么样的破坏，[p/]贾斯汀·维耶是因他进入未授权区域而去世的。

original: Tyrion: And what if I told you that another person may have disabled the door?
translation: Tyrion: 那如果我告诉你或许还有其他人让门失效了呢？

original: Tyrion: Not because of laziness,[p/][s/] but for more nefarious purposes.
translation: Tyrion: 不是因为懒惰，[p/][s/]而是为了更邪恶的目标。

original: Aria: ...What are you talking about?
translation: Aria: ……你在说什么？

original: Tyrion: If you recall,[p/] the witness entered the refinery building and spotted Justin Waye afterward.
translation: Tyrion: 你回想一下，[p/]证人进入炼油厂建筑，并且之后见到了贾斯汀·维耶。

original: Tyrion: This means that Justin Waye entered the building before her.
translation: Tyrion: 这意味着贾斯汀·维耶在她之前进入了炼油厂。

original: Tyrion: So that begs the question:[p/] [i]how[/i] did Justin Waye enter the building?
translation: Tyrion: 那么问题来了：[p/]贾斯汀·维耶是<u>怎么</u>进入炼油厂的？

original: Aria: The answer is obvious.
translation: Aria: 答案显而易见。

original: Aria: He entered the same way the witness did:[p/] through the unlocked door.
translation: Aria: 他也是用证人的方式进去的：[p/]穿过那扇未上锁的门。

original: Tyrion: Not quite,[p/] Ms. Steelwind.
translation: Tyrion: 并不全是，[p/]斯蒂尔文德女士。

original: Tyrion: Since this trial began,[p/] we still haven't answered [i]why[/i] Justin Waye entered the Refinery Building in the first place.
translation: Tyrion: 审判进行到这里，[p/]我们还没有回答这个问题：<u>为什么</u>贾斯汀·维耶一开始会进入炼油厂。

original: Tyrion: He entered the refinery building with the intent of [i]robbing[/i] my client's personal safe.
translation: Tyrion: 他是想要<u>抢劫</u>我的委托人的私人保险箱才进入炼油厂的。

original: Mosourika: I already told you, Tyrion!
translation: Mosourika: 我告诉过你了，提利昂！

original: Mosourika: He would never do something like that!
translation: Mosourika: 他绝不会干这样的事！

original: You feel a little guilty about insulting a dead man's name like this.
translation: 你为这样侮辱一位逝者的名誉感到有些愧疚。

original: ...But it's the only possibility that makes sense.
translation: ……但这是唯一说得通的解释。

original: Tyrion: I'm sorry, Rika.[p/] But there are things about Justin that even [i]you[/i] didn't know about.
translation: Tyrion: 我很抱歉，里卡。[p/]但有些贾斯汀的事即使<u>你</u>也不知道。

original: Tyrion: The truth is that he was deeply in debt to a crime lord named the "Eyetaker".
translation: Tyrion: 事实是，他欠了一个名叫“夺眼者”的犯罪头目一大笔债。

original: Tyrion: And he was extremely desperate to wipe that debt as soon as he could.
translation: Tyrion: 而且他极其迫切地想要尽快还清那笔债务。

original: Mosourika: C-[p/][s/]Crime lord?!
translation: Mosourika: 犯罪、[p/][s/]犯罪头目？！

original: Aria: ...!
translation: Aria: ……！

original: Aria: ...I won't ask [i]how[/i] you came across this information, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: Aria: ……我不会深究你是<u>怎么</u>得到这条信息的，卡斯伯特先生。

original: Aria: But what does [i]this[/i] have to do with the disabled magical lock?
translation: Aria: 但是<u>这</u>和失效的魔法锁有什么联系呢？

original: Tyrion: Ms. Steelwind.[p/] Justin owned a set of tools that he used for picking mundane [i]and[/i] magical locks.
translation: Tyrion: 斯蒂尔文德女士，[p/]贾斯汀拥有一套工具，可以用来开启普通锁<u>和</u>魔法锁。

original: Tyrion: The safe that he was planning to rob was located in my client's office within the Refinery Building.
translation: Tyrion: 他计划抢劫的保险箱位于炼油厂建筑内，我的委托人的办公室里。

original: Tyrion: I have witnesses who [i]saw[/i] Justin retrieve those tools shortly before the night of the accident.
translation: Tyrion: 我有证人<u>亲眼看到</u>贾斯汀在事故发生的前一晚拿出了那些工具。

original: Tyrion: He clearly had a plan to disable any locks that stood between him and that safe.
translation: Tyrion: 他显然已经计划好如何破坏任何挡在他和保险箱之间的锁。

original: Tyrion: This means that it's entirely possible that [i]Justin[/i] disabled the locked Refinery Door illegally.
translation: Tyrion: 这意味着<u>贾斯汀</u>完全有可能通过非法方式让炼油厂的门锁失效了。

original: Celeste: We're not actually going to bring them in, are we?
translation: Celeste: 我们不会真的要把他们带进来，对吧？

original: Tyrion: Yeah...[p/] I'm kind of bluffing, right now...
translation: Tyrion: 不会……[p/]我现在还只是虚张声势……

original: Tyrion: You basically assaulted one of them.
translation: Tyrion: 你基本上就是在攻击其中的一位。

original: Celeste: We [i]both[/i] assaulted him, Tyrion.
translation: Celeste: 我们俩<u>都</u>在攻击他，提利昂。

original: She says that as if it absolves her of [i]any[/i] guilt.
translation: 她这么说着，好像这就能洗脱她的<u>任何</u>罪责。

original: Mosourika: Hold on a minute!
translation: Mosourika: 等等！

original: Mosourika: You can't just accuse him like that when he can't defend himself!
translation: Mosourika: 你不能在他没法辩解的情况下指控他！

original: Tyrion: I'm sorry, Rika.[p/] But his delinquent friends told me about his plan.
translation: Tyrion: 抱歉，里卡。[p/]但他的流氓朋友们告诉了我他的计划。

original: Tyrion: He didn't want to rob Dracogen.[p/] But he needed the gold to wipe away his debt.
translation: Tyrion: 他不想抢劫德拉科根。[p/]但他需要钱来还清债务。

original: Tyrion: If Justin wasn't the one that disabled the lock,[p/] that would only leave Dracogen.
translation: Tyrion: 如果不是贾斯汀让锁失效的话，[p/]那就只能是德拉科根了。

original: Mosourika: ...
translation: Mosourika: ……

original: Mosourika: But...[p/] There has to be an explanation where neither of them is guilty...
translation: Mosourika: 但是……[p/]一定得有一个解释，能让他们俩都无罪……

original: She definitely believes in Justin.
translation: 她全心全意相信贾斯汀。

original: But a scenario where [i]both[/i] Justin and Dracogen are innocent is too optimistic,[p/] if not impossible.
translation: 但如果说贾斯汀和德拉科根<u>都</u>无辜，那就太过乐观了，[p/]甚至可以说是不可能的。

original: But...[p/] It's not as if you are entirely certain of what actually happened that day either...
translation: 但是……[p/]你也不能完全肯定那天到底发生了什么……

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Tyrion: Alright,[p/] Rika.[p/] You knew Justin better than I did.
translation: Tyrion: 没事，[p/]里卡。[p/]你比我更了解贾斯汀。

original: Tyrion: Let's assume that you're correct.[p/]
translation: Tyrion: 让我们假设你是对的。[p/]

original: Tyrion: Neither Justin nor Dracogen disabled the locks that day.
translation: Tyrion: 贾斯汀和德拉科根那一天都没有让锁失效。

original: Tyrion: [i]How[/i] did either of you enter the Refinery then?
translation: Tyrion: 那你和贾斯汀是<u>怎么</u>进入炼油厂的呢？

original: Mosourika: W-[p/]Well,[p/] someone must have disabled it before then...
translation: Mosourika: 呃、[p/]呃，[p/]一定是有人在这之前让锁失效了。

original: Mosourika: W-Wait...[p/] Let me think through this...
translation: Mosourika: 等等……[p/]让我捋一捋思绪……

original: Mosourika: Plenty of people could have disabled the locks.
translation: Mosourika: 很多人都可以让锁失效。

original: Mosourika: Maybe one of the employees got lazy and forcefully broke it.
translation: Mosourika: 可能一个员工犯懒了，用武力破坏了锁。

original: Mosourika: There was also that nobleman who was with Mr. Morrison.[p/] He's a mage and he could have used magic to do it.
translation: Mosourika: 还有那位和莫里森女士一起的贵族，[p/]他是一名法师，完全可以用魔法做到。

original: Mosourika: It could have also been one of the Maintenance Constructs.[p/] I saw one working on the machines.[p/] Maybe one of [i]them[/i] broke the lock.
translation: Mosourika: 也有可能是维护构造体。[p/]我曾看到它们在维护机器,[p/]也许是<u>它们</u>中的某一个破坏了锁。

original: Aria: I can barely even begin to point out all of the issues with your theories, Ms. Tudor.
translation: Aria: 我都不用反驳你的论点中的漏洞，都铎女士。

original: Aria: If you recall,[p/] the entrance lock can [i]only[/i] be disabled by Stefanic Dracogen.
translation: Aria: 你回忆一下，[p/]<u>只有</u>斯蒂芬尼克·德拉科根能让入口的锁失效。

original: Aria: Even Mr. Cuthbert's theory makes more sense than your list of "suspects".
translation: Aria: 卡斯伯特先生的论点都比你那串“嫌疑人”有道理得多。

original: Mosourika: ...
translation: Mosourika: ……

original: Ugh...[p/] She's right.
translation: 呃……[p/]她说的有道理。

original: It doesn't matter how many suspects she presents.
translation: 不管提出多少个嫌疑人。

original: None of them had the credentials to disable the lock.
translation: 他们都没有资格让锁失效。

original: :So why do you feel like there is [i]something else[/i] wrong with her testimony?
translation: :所以为什么你感觉她的证词中<u>还有些别的</u>有问题呢？

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Tyrion: The defense would still like to exercise the right to cross-examine the witness.
translation: Tyrion: 辩方仍然希望行使交叉询问证人的权利。

original: Aria: Hmph...[p/] What a waste of time.
translation: Aria: 哼……[p/]真是浪费时间。

original: Judge: While the court agrees with Ms. Steelwind,[p/] we also recognize Mr. Cuthbert's right to cross-examination.
translation: Judge: 虽然法庭同意斯蒂尔文德女士的观点，但我们也承认卡斯伯特先生的交叉询问权利。

original: Judge: However,[p/] I will [i]not[/i] allow the defense to waste the court's time.
translation: Judge: “不过，[p/]我<u>不</u>允许辩方浪费法庭的时间。

original: Judge: If nothing substantial is gained from your cross-examination,[p/] I will not hesitate to end it early.
translation: Judge: 如果你的交叉询问没有获得任何实质性结果，我将毫不犹豫地提前结束。

original: Tyrion: Understood, Your Honor.
translation: Tyrion: 明白了，法官阁下。

original: Tyrion: But as I've said before,[p/] Dracogen was the only person able to legally disable the lock.
translation: Tyrion: 但是正如我先前所说，[p/]斯蒂芬尼克·德拉科根是唯一一个能用正规方法让门锁失效的人。

original: Tyrion: And Justin Waye was the only person who had the skill set to disable it illegally.
translation: Tyrion: 而贾斯汀·维耶是唯一一个能用非法手段使其失效的人。

original: Mosourika: W-[p/]Well, how do you know that someone [i]else[/i] didn't have tools like that?!
translation: Mosourika: 呃、[p/]呃，你怎么知道不是<u>其他</u>人有这样的工具呢？

original: That's certainly possible...[p/] but unlikely.
translation: 有可能……[p/]但可能性不大。

original: The ability to pick a magical lock seems like a rare skill for [i]anyone[/i] to have.
translation: 开启魔法锁的能力对<u>任何人</u>来说都是一种罕见的技能

original: And as far as you know,[p/] no one else was there unauthorized that day.
translation: 而据你所知，[p/]那天应该没有其他未经授权的人在场。

original: ...Except for maybe Aster and Morrison.
translation: ……除了阿斯特和莫里森。

original: Tyrion: Steelwind,[p/] did the Inquisition find any evidence of physical tampering on the entrance lock?
translation: Tyrion: 斯蒂尔文德，[p/]裁判所是否发现了入口锁被物理篡改的证据？

original: Aria: Not at all.
translation: Aria: 并没有。

original: Aria: Furthermore,[p/] if an employee [i]had[/i] attempted what the witness is describing,[p/] it would have set off the refinery's security system.
translation: Aria: 此外，[p/]如果一名员工真如证人所描述的那样尝试了某些行为，[p/]那么炼油厂的安保系统肯定会触发。

original: Tyrion: Hm...[p/] Sorry, Rika.
translation: Tyrion: 嗯……[p/]抱歉，里卡。

original: Mosourika: W-[p/]Well...
translation: Mosourika: 呃、[p/]呃……

original: Aria: The harbourmaster's companion would have no reason to perform such an act.
translation: Aria: 港务长的同伴没理由这么做。

original: Tyrion: ...Your personal bias might be clouding your judgment, Ms. Steelwind.
translation: Tyrion: ……你的个人偏见或许会干扰你的判断，斯蒂尔文德女士。

original: Aria: This isn't merely an extrapolation based on his character, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: Aria: 这不仅仅是对他性格的推测，卡斯伯特先生。

original: Aria: The "nobleman" in question had the legal authority to enter the building.
translation: Aria: 这位有待确认的“贵族”有着进入炼油厂的合法授权。

original: Aria: He wouldn't [i]need[/i] to resort to such underhanded tactics.
translation: Aria: 他不<u>需要</u>采取这么下三滥的手段。

original: Right...[p/] As the crown prince,[p/] he could legally enter the Arcane Refinery if he wanted to.
translation: 对……[p/]作为王储殿下，[p/]他可以随心所欲地合法进出奥术炼油厂。

original: In fact,[p/] that's probably how he entered in the first place.
translation: 实际上，[p/]这大概就是他一开始进去的方法。

original: Aria: ...You would probably know that since you two seem [i]so[/i] close with each other.
translation: Aria: ……你们俩看起来关系那么亲密，你估计会知道吧。

original: Celeste: Is she...[p/] jealous of our relationship with Aster?
translation: Celeste: 她是在……[p/]嫉妒我们和阿斯特的关系吗？

original: Maybe it'd be best to avoid bringing up Aster with her.
translation: 或许避免向她提起阿斯特为妙。

original: Tyrion: "Maintenance Construct"?
translation: Tyrion: “维护构造体”？

original: Mosourika: Y'know.[p/] Those magically animated suits of armor.
translation: Mosourika: 你知道的。[p/]那些魔法驱动的全身盔甲。

original: Oh,[p/] she must have seen an Arcane Construct while she was exploring the Refinery.
translation: 噢，[p/]她一定是在探索炼油厂的时候见到了一个奥术构造体。

original: Aria: Arcane Constructs only perform the actions that they're ordered to do.
translation: Aria: 奥术构造体只干那些被命令的事。

original: Aria: And a Construct at the Arcane Refinery would only take orders from their administrator:[p/] Stefanic Dracogen.
translation: Aria: 并且奥术炼油厂的奥术构造体只会接受来自他们主人：[p/]斯蒂芬尼克·德拉科根，的指令

original: Aria: Unless you want to imply that [i]Stefanic Dracogen[/i] ordered the Construct to break the lock.
translation: Aria: 除非你的意思是<u>斯蒂芬尼克·德拉科根</u>命令奥术构造体破坏门锁。

original: Tyrion: May I remind the prosecution that Constructs are prone to error and misinterpretation of their orders?
translation: Tyrion: 我想提醒一下检方，构造体也可能出错，错误理解它们收到的指令。

original: Tyrion: Perhaps this Construct accidentally broke the lock while carrying out its usual orders.
translation: Tyrion: 或许奥术构造体在执行常规任务时不小心破坏了门锁。

original: Aria: The Inquisition found no evidence of physical tampering on the lock.
translation: Aria: 裁判所没有发现门锁被物理篡改的证据。

original: Aria: And even if they had,[p/] the security system would have been alerted the moment this happened.
translation: Aria: 而且就算构造体这么做了，[p/]门锁被破坏的一瞬间安保系统就会触发。

original: Celeste: Well,[p/] I guess you have a [i]lot[/i] of contradicting statements to work with this time.
translation: Celeste: 嗯，[p/]我想，这次你有<u>一堆</u>互相矛盾的陈述需要处理了啊。

original: Tyrion: Yeah...[p/] I need to find a contradiction that's not so readily apparent.
translation: Tyrion: 是啊……[p/]我得找到一个不那么明显的矛盾点。

original: Celeste: One that's "not apparent"?
translation: Celeste: “不那么明显”的？

original: Celeste: There's [i]another[/i] contradiction in her testimony?
translation: Celeste: 她的证词里还有<u>另一个</u>矛盾点？

original: Tyrion: I'm not sure...[p/] But I can't help but feel like she said something that doesn't fit with what we know already.
translation: Tyrion: 我不确定……[p/]但我总觉得她说了些和我们已经知道的事实不符的话。

original: Ignore the list of suspects and focus on the other details.
translation: 先别管嫌疑人的名单，专注于其他的细节。

original: She observed a lot that day.[p/] So [i]something[/i] must be off with her observations.
translation: 那天她观察了很多东西，[p/]所以她的观察里肯定有<u>某些地方</u>不对劲。

original: Tyrion: But as I've said before Rika,[p/] Dracogen was the only person able to legally disable the lock.
translation: Tyrion: 但是正如我先前所说，[p/]斯蒂芬尼克·德拉科根是唯一一个能用正规方法让门锁失效的人。

original: Tyrion: Justin Waye was the only person who had the skill set to disable it illegally.
translation: Tyrion: 贾斯汀·维耶是唯一一个能用非法手段使其失效的人。

original: Mosourika: W-[p/]Well, how do you know that someone [i]else[/i] didn't have that same skill set?!
translation: Mosourika: 呃、[p/]呃，你怎么知道不是<u>其他</u>人有一样的工具呢？

original: That's certainly possible...[p/] but unlikely.
translation: 有可能……[p/]但可能性不大。

original: The ability to pick a magical lock seems like a rare skill for [i]anyone[/i] to have.
translation: 开启魔法锁的能力对<u>任何人</u>来说都是一种罕见的技能

original: And as far as you know,[p/] no one else there unauthorized that day.
translation: 而据你所知，[p/]那天应该没有其他未经授权的人在场。

original: ...Except for maybe Aster and Morrison.
translation: ……除了阿斯特和莫里森。

original: Tyrion: Ms. Steelwind did the Inquisition find any evidence of physical tampering on the entrance lock?
translation: Tyrion: 斯蒂尔文德女士，[p/]裁判所是否发现了门锁被物理篡改的证据？

original: Aria: Not at all.
translation: Aria: 并没有。

original: Aria: Furthermore,[p/] if an employee [i]had[/i] attempted what the witness is describing,[p/] it would have set off the refinery's security system.
translation: Aria: 此外，[p/]如果一名员工真如证人所描述的那样尝试了某些行为，[p/]那么炼油厂的安保系统肯定会触发。

original: Tyrion: Hm...[p/] Sorry, Rika.
translation: Tyrion: 嗯……[p/]抱歉，里卡。

original: Mosourika: ...
translation: Mosourika: ……

original: Tyrion: Your Honor![p/][s/] It's clear that the witness's testimony is contradictory!
translation: Tyrion: 法官阁下！[p/][s/]证人的证言明显存在矛盾！

original: Tyrion: And [i]this[/i] piece of evidence proves it!
translation: Tyrion: <u>这个</u>就是相关证据！

original: Aria: Well,[p/] I suppose you're correct in that, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: Aria: 唔，[p/]我想你说得对，卡斯伯特先生。

original: Aria: Almost every element of the witness's testimony is contradictory.
translation: Aria: 证人的证词中，几乎每个要素都存在矛盾。

original: Mosourika: ...
translation: Mosourika: ……

original: Right...[p/] This isn't like your usual testimony.
translation: 对的……[p/]这不像你平时遇见的证词。

original: But something is still off about her testimony.
translation: 她的证词中还有什么不对劲的地方。

original: You just need to find out what.
translation: 你只需要找出来。

original: Wait...[p/] That can't be right,[p/] can it...?
translation: 等等……[p/]该不会是那个吧，[p/]是吗……?

original: Tyrion: Rika...[p/] You said that you saw a "Maintenance Construct" inside the refinery building.
translation: Tyrion: 里卡……[p/]你说你在炼油厂里看见了一个“维护构造体”。

original: Tyrion: Are you [i]sure[/i] that it was an Arcane Construct?
translation: Tyrion: 你<u>确定</u>那是一个奥术构造体吗？

original: Mosourika: Yeah.[p/] I've been keeping an eye on them in the Von Sanctus catalogs.
translation: Mosourika: 是的。[p/]我一直在关注冯·桑克图斯的目录中关于它们的相关记录。

original: Mosourika: But they're not available to the public yet.
translation: Mosourika: 但它们还不向大众出售。

original: Tyrion: When you saw this Arcane Construct,[p/] what was it doing?
translation: Tyrion: 你看见这个奥术构造体的时候，[p/]它在做什么？

original: Mosourika: Um...[p/] I'm not exactly sure.
translation: Mosourika: 呃……[p/]我不确定。

original: Mosourika: But it looked like it was doing maintenance on the machines.
translation: Mosourika: 但是它看起来在给其他机械做维护工作。

original: "Maintenance on the machines"?
translation: “给机械做维护工作”？

original: But it shouldn't have been there in the first place...
translation: 但它一开始就不应该出现在那里……

original: What was it doing there?![p/][s/] And more importantly,[p/][s/] [i]who[/i] sent it there?!
translation: 它在那里做什么？！[p/][s/]更重要的是，[p/][s/]<u>谁</u>把它带过去的？！

original: Aria: Where are you going with this, Mr. Cuthbert?
translation: Aria: 你问这些干什么，卡斯伯特先生。

original: Aria: As I've said before,[p/] an Arcane Construct owned by the defendant wouldn't have disabled the lock.
translation: Aria: 我说过了，[p/]被告的奥术构造体不可能让锁失效。

original: Aria: Arcane Constructs only perform the actions that they're ordered to do.
translation: Aria: 奥术构造体只做被命令的事情。

original: Aria: A Construct at Arcane Refinery would only take orders from their administrator:[p/] Stefanic Dracogen.
translation: Aria: 奥术炼油厂的奥术构造体只会接受来自他们主人：[p/]斯蒂芬尼克·德拉科根，的指令

original: Aria: Unless you want to imply that the Construct broke the lock on his orders.
translation: Aria: 除非你的意思是他命令奥术构造体破坏了门锁。

original: Tyrion: I agree.[p/] A Construct owned by [i]my client[/i] wouldn't have done that.
translation: Tyrion: 我同意。[p/]<u>我的委托人</u>的奥术构造体没有那么做。

original: Tyrion: But Arcane Constructs are extremely rare and not available to the general public yet.
translation: Tyrion: 但是奥术构造体还很稀有，也不对大众出售。

original: Tyrion: Furthermore,[p/] they are only produced and sold by Von Sanctus Industries.
translation: Tyrion: 而且，[p/]只有冯·桑克图斯工业制作并出售它们。

original: Tyrion: Lloyd Von Sanctus personally sold several products to the Dracogen Trading Company.
translation: Tyrion: 洛伊德·冯·桑克图斯私下将几件产品卖给了德拉科根贸易公司。

original: Tyrion: However,[p/] when offered the opportunity to purchase his Arcane Constructs...
translation: Tyrion: 但是，[p/]当获得购买奥术构造体的机会时……

original: Tyrion: ...my client turned him down!
translation: Tyrion: ……我的委托人拒绝了。

original: Aria: What...?
translation: Aria: 什么……？

original: Tyrion: My client disliked the Constructs' flawed intelligence.[p/] He didn't want them working in the refinery.
translation: Tyrion: 我的委托人不喜欢那些智能存在缺陷的构造体。[p/]他根本不希望它们在精炼厂工作。

original: Tyrion: He turned down Lord von Sanctus' offer in favor of utilizing human labor.
translation: Tyrion: 他拒绝了冯·桑克图斯勋爵的提议，[p/]选择依靠人力劳工。

original: Mosourika: Wait...[p/] Then why did I see a Construct there?
translation: Mosourika: 等等……[p/]那为什么我会在那看见奥术构造体？

original: Tyrion: Exactly.
translation: Tyrion: 正是如此。

original: Tyrion: If my client did [i]not[/i] own any Constructs,[p/][s/] [i]why[/i] did the witness see one there?
translation: Tyrion: 如果我的委托人<u>没有</u>任何构造体，[p/][s/]<u>为什么</u>证人会在那见到？

original: Tyrion: Or to phrase this question differently,[p/] [i]who[/i] sent that Construct there?
translation: Tyrion: 换句话说，[p/]<u>谁</u>整了一个构造体进去？

original: Aria: "Who"...?
translation: Aria: “谁”……？

original: Aria: Why would [i]anyone[/i] send an Arcane Construct into the refinery?
translation: Aria: 为什么会<u>有人</u>把奥术构造体弄进炼油厂？

original: Tyrion: First,[p/] let's consider the rarity of Arcane Constructs.
translation: Tyrion: 首先，[p/]考虑到奥术构造体的稀有程度。

original: Tyrion: They are highly experimental and not available to the public yet.
translation: Tyrion: 它们还处于高度实验阶段，而且不向大众出售。

original: Tyrion: With all of these elements in mind,[p/][s/] only [i]one[/i] person in the city of Aurinax could have done this.
translation: Tyrion: 考虑到这些因素，[p/][s/]这座城市只有<u>一个</u>人能够做得到。

original: Aria: ...Wait!
translation: Aria: ……等等！

original: Aria: You can't possibly mean...
translation: Aria: 你应该不是指……

original: Tyrion: I do, Ms. Steelwind.
translation: Tyrion: 就是这样，斯蒂尔文德女士。

original: Tyrion: Few individuals had access to an Arcane Construct.
translation: Tyrion: 很少有人能够接触到奥术构造体。

original: Tyrion: And even fewer had the ability to disable the locked door [i]without[/i] alerting the security system.
translation: Tyrion: 能够在<u>不</u>触发安全系统的情况下让门锁失效的人就更少了。

original: Judge: I...[p/] fail to see how [i]that[/i] individual could have used a Construct [i]and[/i] have disabled the door lock.
translation: Judge: 我……[p/]不知道<u>那个</u>人怎么操纵一个奥术构造体，<u>而且</u>还让门锁失效了。

original: Tyrion: R-[p/]Right...[p/] I guess I see what you mean...
translation: Tyrion: 对、[p/]对的……[p/]我想我明白你的意思了……

original: Aria: ...
translation: Aria: ……

original: Tyrion: B-[p/][s/]But,[p/] there [i]is[/i] a person who could have done these things!
translation: Tyrion: 但、[p/][s/]但是，[p/]<u>还是</u>有人可以做到这些事情的！

original: Think about this clearly.[p/] Arcane Constructs are not available to the general public yet.
translation: 好好思考一下。[p/]奥术构造体还不向大众出售。

original: Only a select few individuals have access to them.
translation: 只有很少一部分人能够接触到。

original: Thankfully,[p/] there is one person involved in this case that would [i]definitely[/i] have access to one.
translation: 谢天谢地，[p/]本案中<u>确实</u>有一个人拥有接触奥术构造体的权限。

original: Tyrion: Only one individual could have done everything that I described.
translation: Tyrion: 只有一个人可能做了我说的那些事。

original: Tyrion: Lloyd von Sanctus:[p/] the noble lord of Aurinax!
translation: Tyrion: 洛伊德·冯·桑克图斯：[p/]欧奥耐克斯尊贵的勋爵！

original: Aria: You can't be serious!
translation: Aria: 你是认真的吗？

original: Aria: Are you accusing [i]Lord von Sanctus[/i] of illegally sending a Construct into the Arcane Refinery?
translation: Aria: 你是在指控<u>冯·桑克图斯勋爵</u>非法将一架构造体送进了奥术炼油厂？

original: Aria: What possible reason would he have to do that?!
translation: Aria: 他有什么理由那么做？！

original: When Rika saw the Construct,[p/] she said that it was "working on the machines"...
translation: 里卡看见构造体时，[p/]她说它正在“维护机器”。

original: But that Construct was sent by von Sanctus...[p/] It didn't actually "work" for Dracogen.
translation: 但这是冯·桑克图斯派来的构造体……[p/]它并不是在为德拉科根做“维护”。

original: Wait...[p/][s/] Could that mean?!
translation: 等等……[p/][s/]难道说？！

original: Tyrion: Rika![p/][s/] When you saw that Construct in the Refinery, was it carrying anything?!
translation: Tyrion: 里卡！[p/][s/]当你在炼油厂看到那个构造体时，它有在运什么东西吗？

original: Mosourika: U-[p/]Um...[p/][s/] Yeah, actually!
translation: Mosourika: 呃、[p/]呃……[p/][s/]对的！

original: Mosourika: It was carrying a large cylindrical machine.[p/] And it looked pretty heavy.
translation: Mosourika: 它正在运一个巨大的圆柱形机器，[p/]那个机器看起来很重。

original: Tyrion: Like it would normally need to be held by two people?
translation: Tyrion: 就像那种通常得要两个人才能搬起来的机器？

original: Mosourika: Yeah![p/][s/] How did you know?!
translation: Mosourika: 对！[p/][s/]你怎么知道的？！

original: It all makes sense now.[p/] Von Sanctus has been far too aggressive in pushing these charges.
translation: 现在一切都说得通了，[p/]冯·桑克图斯实在太过激进地推动这些指控了。

original: It wasn't because he was desperate to get rid of Dracogen.
translation: 并不是因为他急于除掉德拉科根。

original: It was because he needed to cover up what [i]actually[/i] happened!
translation: 而是因为他需要掩盖<u>真正</u>发生的事情！

original: Judge: Mr. Cuthbert![p/][s/] Where are you going with this?!
translation: Judge: 卡斯伯特先生！[p/][s/]你要扯到哪里去？！

original: Tyrion: You see, Your Honor.[p/] The tool that the witness saw this Construct carrying wasn't just any tool.
translation: Tyrion: 如你所见，法官阁下。[p/]奥术构造体那时搬运的并不是什么机器。

original: Tyrion: It was a Rod of Mending:[p/] an artificery tool that channels [b]transmutation[/b] magic.
translation: Tyrion: 那是一根修复之杖：[p/]一种注入[b]形变术[/b]魔法的奥术能源工具。

original: Aria: "[b]Transmutation[/b] magic.
translation: Aria: [b]形变术[/b]魔法。

original: Aria: As in...[p/] magic that could be used to weaken and sabotage parts of the refinery.
translation: Aria: 也就是说……[p/]那是可以用来削弱和破坏炼油厂部分设施的魔法。

original: Judge: No...[p/] Are you seriously accusing...
translation: Judge: 不会吧……[p/]你真的是在指控……

original: Tyrion: Your Honor![p/][s/] Lloyd von Sanctus sent a Construct into the Arcane Refinery to sabotage it!
translation: Tyrion: 法官阁下！[p/][s/]洛伊德·冯·桑克图斯将构造体送入奥术炼油厂就是为了破坏它！

original: Tyrion: In other words,[p/] Lloyd von Sanctus is responsible for that guard rail breaking!
translation: Tyrion: 换句话说，[p/]洛伊德·冯·桑克图斯应该对护栏的损坏负责！

original: Lloyd: ...I think that's enough out of you, you upstart commoner.
translation: Lloyd: ……我觉得你已经说得够多了，你这个自以为是的平民。

original: Celeste: The judge really needs to stop these guys from just barging onto the stand.
translation: Celeste: 法官就应该阻止这些人随便冲上证人席。

original: To be fair,[p/] who's going to stop a noble from a pillar family?
translation: 说实话，[p/]谁能阻止一个出自显赫家族的贵族呢？

original: Lloyd: I've had enough of these blatant accusations.
translation: Lloyd: 我受够了这些明目张胆的指控。

original: Lloyd: If you want to sling mud at my name,[p/] you [i]will[/i] do it to me directly.
translation: Lloyd: 如果你想抹黑我的名字，[p/]<u>就应该</u>直接冲我来。

original: Aria: ...Lord von Sanctus,[p/] I would highly advise against doing this.
translation: Aria: ……冯·桑克图斯勋爵，[p/]我强烈建议不要这么做。

original: Lloyd: Please.[p/] Do you think I'm like that fool Pierce?
translation: Lloyd: 拜托。[p/]你觉得我像那个傻瓜皮尔斯吗？

original: Lloyd: The defense's theory is laughable.[p/] And I have several pieces of evidence that can easily prove my innocence.
translation: Lloyd: 辩方的理论可笑至极。[p/]而且我有几份证据可以轻松证明我的清白。

original: He has a good poker face.[p/] But the Eye is telling you that he's a little desperate.
translation: 他的脸上看起来镇定自若。[p/]但荷鲁斯之眼告诉你，他已经有点绝望了。

original: Judge: V-[p/]Very well.[p/] If the defense wishes to accuse you,[p/] I see no harm in allowing you to defend yourself.
translation: Judge: 很、[p/]很好。[p/]既然辩方要指控你，[p/]你不妨为自己辩护一下。

original: Judge: The court would very much like to hear your testimony on the matter.
translation: Judge: 法庭很想听听你在这件事上的证词。

original: Aria: ...
translation: Aria: ……

original: Lloyd: It [i]is[/i] possible to order a Construct to complete a complex list of tasks.[p/] But doing so is ill-advised.
translation: Lloyd: <u>确实</u>有可能命令构造体去完成一系列复杂的任务。[p/]但这么做是不明智的。

original: Lloyd: I'm sure you observed this with the Nightgrave trial.[p/] Constructs are extremely prone to error when completing a long list of tasks.
translation: Lloyd: 我肯定你在奈特格雷夫一案中也注意到了这一点。[p/]构造体在完成一长串任务时极易出错。

original: Lloyd: According to the defense,[p/] the saboteur stole a Rod of Mending and used it to sabotage very [i]specific[/i] sections of the refinery.
translation: Lloyd: 根据辩方的说法，[p/]破坏者偷了一根修复之杖，并用它来破坏炼油厂的<u>特定</u>部分。

original: Lloyd: I would never trust a Construct to discreetly complete such an intricate set of tasks unsupervised.
translation: Lloyd: 我绝不会信任一个构造体在无人监督的情况下偷偷完成这样一套复杂精细的任务。

original: Lloyd: And before you ask,[p/] I was miles away from the refinery at the time of the accident.[p/] I have several associates who can confirm this alibi.
translation: Lloyd: 而且我要告诉你，[p/]事故发生时，我离炼油厂有好几英里远。[p/]我有几个熟人可以做这个不在场证明。

original: Lloyd: Therefore,[p/] I had no way of observing this Construct from afar.[p/] Nor did I have any way to communicate with it.
translation: Lloyd: 所以，[p/]我是没有办法在远处看着这个构造体的。[p/]我也无法与它进行沟通。

original: That...[p/] actually makes a lot of sense.
translation: 这……[p/]确实很有道理。

original: The Nightgrave trial revealed the risks of ordering a Construct to commit a crime.
translation: 奈特格雷夫一案揭示了命令构造体去犯罪所存在的风险。

original: ...But nevertheless,[p/] Rika [i]saw[/i] a Construct at the Refinery that day.[p/] That's indisputable.
translation: ……但是不管怎样，[p/]里卡那天还是<u>看见了</u>炼油厂里有一个构造体。[p/]这是毋庸置疑的。

original: He definitely gave the Construct a complex list of tasks to sabotage the Refinery.[p/] And that raises one question.
translation: 他肯定给构造体安排了一系列复杂的任务去破坏炼油厂。[p/]而这就引发了一个问题。

original: How did he account for the Constructs' error-prone logic?
translation: 他是怎么处理构造体逻辑容易出错的问题的？

original: Tyrion: Is that not a massive flaw in the Construct's design?
translation: Tyrion: 这难道不是构造体设计中的一个巨大缺陷吗？

original: Lloyd: Artificery can only do so much.
translation: Lloyd: 奥术能源只有这么大的能耐。

original: Lloyd: It's difficult enough to create magical items that respond to verbal commands.
translation: Lloyd: 制造能响应口头指令的魔法物品已经够难的了。

original: Lloyd: But our magic is still not advanced enough to replicate the common sense of a living creature.
translation: Lloyd: 但我们的魔法还不够先进，无法复制生物的常识。

original: Lloyd: The Arcane Construct is still a marvelous invention.
translation: Lloyd: 奥术构造体仍然是一个了不起的发明。

original: Lloyd: You merely need to supervise them if you give them complex tasks.
translation: Lloyd: 如果想派给它们复杂的任务，你只要监督它们就够了。

original: Tyrion: But regardless,[p/] you admitted that it [i]is[/i] possible.
translation: Tyrion: 尽管如此，[p/]你承认了那<u>是</u>有可能的。

original: Lloyd: Yes,[p/] but...
translation: Lloyd: 是的，[p/]但是……

original: Tyrion: Are you referring to what happened with Theodore Redmond's Construct?
translation: Tyrion: 你是指西奥多·雷德蒙的构造体上所发生的事吗？

original: Lloyd: I am.
translation: Lloyd: 是的。

original: Lloyd: It goes without saying that the Constructs weren't designed to aid and abet murder.
translation: Lloyd: 不用说，构建体的设计并不是为了协助谋杀。

original: Lloyd: But they also weren't designed to carry out such a long list of tasks unsupervised.
translation: Lloyd: 但它们的设计也不是为了在无人监督的情况下执行这么长的任务清单。

original: Lloyd: A lot of Redmond's orders fell well outside of the Construct's intended usage.
translation: Lloyd: 雷德蒙的许多命令都远远超出了构造体的预期用途。

original: Lloyd: He ordered it to transport a human body from one point to another.
translation: Lloyd: 他命令构造体把尸体从一处运至另一处。

original: Lloyd: And he even ordered it to play audio to make itself look like a person.
translation: Lloyd: 他甚至还命令构造体播放音频，好让它自己看起来像个人。

original: Lloyd: I'm sure you know how that ended.
translation: Lloyd: 我想你知道最后是如何告终的。

original: He's right.[p/] The Construct encountered unforeseen circumstances and failed to complete its tasks...
translation: 他是对的。[p/]构造体遇到了意料之外的情况，没能完成任务……

original: But as the Constructs' creator,[p/] von Sanctus knew that such circumstances would be unavoidable...
translation: 作为构造体的创造者，[p/]冯·桑克图斯知道这种情况是不可避免的……

original: So how did he get around that?
translation: 所以他是怎么处理的？

original: Tyrion: That's correct.
translation: Tyrion: 对的。

original: Tyrion: As the chairman of Von Sanctus Industries,[p/] you would have the resources and know-how to use it in such a way.
translation: Tyrion: 作为冯·桑克图斯工业的董事长，[p/]你有资源和专业知识来这样使用它。

original: Lloyd: Yes.[p/] I suppose I would.
translation: Lloyd: 是的。[p/]我是可以。

original: Lloyd: But you forget that I couldn't have been there personally.
translation: Lloyd: 但是你忘了我人不可能在现场。

original: Tyrion: Perhaps you were desperate enough to take a chance like that.
translation: Tyrion: 有可能你只是太绝望了，不得不抓住这样的机会。

original: Lloyd: Please.[p/] I'll admit that I find Dracogen to be a nuisance to my holdings.
translation: Lloyd: 拜托。[p/]我承认德拉科根对我来说是个麻烦。

original: Lloyd: But I was hardly in a position to resort to such desperate tactics.
translation: Lloyd: 但我还没有到要用这么绝望的方法的地步。

original: That [i]does[/i] make sense.
translation: <u>确实</u>有道理。

original: You suppose that he was never planning for things to come back to him.
translation: 你猜他从没有想过事情会绕到他身上。

original: If Celeste hadn't cast [b]Detect Magic[/b],[p/] no one would have ever known that someone used magic within the refinery.
translation: 如果塞莱斯特没有用[b]法术探测[/b]，[p/]没有人会知道炼油厂内有人用过魔法。

original: Tyrion: And I suppose you wouldn't mind having these "associates" testify before the court.
translation: Tyrion: 我想你也不介意让这些“熟人”在法庭上作证吧。

original: Aria: Lord von Sanctus was discussing the blockade being put around the city.
translation: Aria: 冯·桑克图斯勋爵当时正在讨论封城的事情。

original: Lloyd: Steelwind...
translation: Lloyd: 斯蒂尔文德……

original: Aria: ...I won't go into detail about [i]what[/i] they discussed.[p/] But the Kingsguard,[p/] City Watch,[p/] Arcane Inquisition,[p/] and myself were present.
translation: Aria: ……我不会细说他们讨论了些<u>什么</u>。[p/]但是国王卫队、[p/]城市安保、[p/]奥术裁判所[p/]和我都在现场。

original: Aria: We can [i]all[/i] confirm that he was present at the meeting.
translation: Aria: 我们<u>都</u>能证明他在讨论会的现场。

original: Aria: ...Although,[p/] his behavior was quite erratic that day.
translation: Aria: 艾丽娅：……尽管，[p/]那天他的行为相当反常。

original: Lloyd: Ugh...[p/] How could I not?
translation: Lloyd: 呃……[p/]我怎么会不反常？

original: Lloyd: You people have no care for personal hygiene.[p/] It took my retainers hours to disinfect the area.
translation: Lloyd: 你们这些人根本不讲究个人卫生。[p/]我的仆人花了好几个小时才把那地方消毒干净。

original: Tyrion: Um...[p/] Can we please stay on subject?
translation: Tyrion: 呃……[p/]我们能言归正传吗？

original: Lloyd: Right...[p/] Anyways...
translation: Lloyd: 好的……[p/]不论如何……

original: Tyrion: What if the Construct wasn't actually active?
translation: Tyrion: 但如果构造体其实并没有被激活呢？

original: Tyrion: You could have had one of your servants don the Construct as a disguise.
translation: Tyrion: 你可以让你的仆人穿上构造体来作为伪装。

original: Lloyd: It's extremely dangerous to wear the Construct like a suit of armor.
translation: Lloyd: 像盔甲那样穿构造体是很危险的。

original: Lloyd: It almost always ends in severe injury and death in the worst case.
translation: Lloyd: 最糟糕的情况下，几乎会导致重伤和死亡。

original: Lloyd: Furthermore,[p/] this supposed Construct would have needed to carry and use a Rod of Mending.
translation: Lloyd: 而且，[p/]这个所谓的构造体还要搬运并使用修复之杖。

original: Lloyd: I have many capable servants...[p/] But none of them have superhuman strength.
translation: Lloyd: 我有许多能干的仆人……[p/]但是没有人有超人的力量。

original: Right...[p/] Your theory only makes sense if the [i]Construct[/i] was the one carrying the Rod.
translation: 是的……[p/]只有在<u>构造体</u>是唯一一个搬运修复之杖的家伙时，你的理论才说得通。

original: Celeste: His argument makes a lot of sense, actually.
translation: Celeste: 实际上，他的论点很有道理。

original: Celeste: He wouldn't trust a Construct to sabotage the refinery alone,[p/] especially if there was such a big risk of getting caught.
translation: Celeste: 他不会放心让一个构造体独自破坏炼油厂的，[p/]尤其是在这么大的被抓住的风险下。

original: Tyrion: Hm...[p/] But regardless of what he says,[p/] Rika [i]did[/i] see a Construct there that day.
translation: Tyrion: 嗯……[p/]但是不管他怎么说，[p/]里卡那天还是<u>看见了</u>炼油厂里有一个构造体。

original: You doubt that he'd take a risk like that.
translation: 你怀疑他会冒险一试。

original: So he must have had a way to ensure that the Construct completed its task correctly.
translation: 他肯定有方法保证构造体正确完成任务。

original: He's a noble from a pillar family and he's probably an accomplished mage.
translation: 他是一个出自显赫家族的贵族，多半还是个有所成就的法师。

original: Could he have used that somehow?
translation: 他会利用这一点吗？

original: Tyrion: Your Honor![p/][s/] It's clear that the witness's testimony is contradictory!
translation: Tyrion: 法官阁下！[p/][s/]证人的证言明显存在矛盾！

original: Tyrion: And [i]this[/i] piece of evidence proves it!
translation: Tyrion: <u>这个</u>就是相关证据！

original: Judge: I fail to see how [i]that[/i] proves anything, Mr. Cuthbert...
translation: Judge: 卡斯伯特先生……我没看出来这两者有什么关系。

original: Tyrion: O-[p/]Oh...[p/] I guess you're right.
translation: Tyrion: 啊、[p/]哦……[p/] 好像是这样的。

original: Tyrion: Von Sanctus.[p/] You testified that there was no way for you to observe and communicate with the Construct.
translation: Tyrion: 冯·桑克图斯。[p/]你作证你不可能看着构造体并和它交流。

original: Tyrion: Am I correct?
translation: Tyrion: 我没说错吧？

original: Lloyd: Yes.[p/] I was at that meeting with Steelwind for that entire day.[p/] [i]Anyone[/i] there could testify to that fact.
translation: Lloyd: 是的。[p/]那一整天我都在和斯蒂尔文德一起的讨论会。[p/]那里的<u>任何人</u>都可以证明这一点。

original: Tyrion: I'm not disputing your so-called "alibi".[p/] But it's not as air-tight as you might think.
translation: Tyrion: 我不是在质疑你所谓的“不在场证明”。[p/]但它并不像你想象的那么无懈可击。

original: Aria: ...What are you talking about?
translation: Aria: ……你在说什么？

original: Aria: I was [i]there[/i] at that meeting, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: Aria: 我就<u>在</u>讨论会现场，卡斯伯特先生。

original: Aria: Lord von Sanctus may have been absent in mind...[p/] but he [i]was[/i] there physically.
translation: Aria: 冯·桑克图斯勋爵可能有点心不在焉……[p/]但他人<u>是</u>在那里的。

original: Lloyd: ...
translation: Lloyd: ……

original: "Absent in mind"...?[p/] So his attention [i]wasn't[/i] focused on the meeting...
translation: “心不在焉”……？[p/]所以他的注意力<u>并不在</u>讨论会上……

original: Which means that his attention was somewhere else.
translation: 也就是说他的注意力在别的地方。

original: Tyrion: I suppose you're correct, Ms. Steelwind.[p/] But I still have one question for you, Lord von Sanctus.
translation: Tyrion: 假设你是对的，斯蒂尔文德女士。[p/]但我还有一个问题，冯·桑克图斯先生。

original: Lloyd: Pah...[p/] And what would that be?
translation: Lloyd: 哈……[p/]什么问题？

original: Tyrion: Are you able to cast the [b]Send Message[/b] spell?
translation: Tyrion: 你会用[b]通信术[/b]吗？

original: Lloyd: ...!
translation: Lloyd: ……！

original: Aria: ...What?
translation: Aria: ……什么？

original: Tyrion: Ms. Steelwind, your client may have been physically at the meeting.[p/] But his attention was somewhere else, wasn't it?
translation: Tyrion: 斯蒂尔文德女士，你的委托人虽然在讨论会现场，[p/]但他的注意力在别处，对吧？

original: Aria: ...
translation: Aria: ……

original: Tyrion: He could have used a combination of spells to view the Construct [i]during[/i] the meeting.
translation: Tyrion: 他完全可以使用一些法术的结合来<u>在</u>讨论会期间看着构造体。

original: Tyrion: And he could have used the [b]Send Message[/b] spell to communicate with it over a large distance.
translation: Tyrion: 而且他说不定就是用的[b]通信术[/b]来远距离交流的。

original: Tyrion: [i]If[/i] my claim is truly false,[p/] your client should have no trouble disproving it with his [b]Spell Compendium[/b].
translation: Tyrion: <u>如果</u>我的陈述有误，[p/]你的委托人应该能用他的[b]法术汇编[/b]轻松证明。

original: Lloyd: I-[p/]I...[p/] W-[p/]Well...
translation: Lloyd: 我、[p/]我……[p/]呃、[p/]呃……

original: Aria: ...von Sanctus.
translation: Aria: ……冯·桑克图斯。

original: Tyrion: You appear to be hesitating, von Sanctus.
