original: Stefanic: There was [i]one[/i] tool that was unaccounted for.
translation: Stefanic: 确实有<u>一个</u>找不到了。

original: Tyrion: Really?[p/] What kind of tool was it?
translation: Tyrion: 真的吗？[p/]是哪种工具？

original: Stefanic: A Rod of Mending.[p/] It's a large tool that we use to repair damage on the machines.
translation: Stefanic: 是一根修复之杖，[p/]一种我们用来修复机器上的损伤的大型工具。

original: Tyrion: A tool for repairs?[p/] How large was it?
translation: Tyrion: 用于修复的工具？[p/]它有多大？

original: Stefanic: Quite large, actually.
translation: Stefanic: 实际上，非常大。

original: Stefanic: It's called a "rod", but it's more of a large cylindrical tool.
translation: Stefanic: 它叫“杖”，但其实更像是一个大型圆柱形工具。

original: Stefanic: It requires two people to properly carry and use it.
translation: Stefanic: 需要两个人才能搬运使用。

original: Celeste: ...
translation: Celeste: ……

original: Celeste: Wait...[p/] A repair tool like that would use [b]transmutation[/b] magic, right?
translation: Celeste: 等等……[p/]它是一种会使用[b]形变术[/b]魔法的修复工具，对吧？

original: Tyrion: ...!
translation: Tyrion: ……！

original: Tyrion: That's right!
translation: Tyrion: 这就对了！

original: Celeste: What if the [i]Rod of Mending[/i] was the thing that weakened the guard rail?!
translation: Celeste: 假如是<u>修复之杖</u>破坏了护栏呢？

original: Tyrion: Is that possible, Dracogen?
translation: Tyrion: 有可能吗，德拉科根？

original: Stefanic: I suppose that [i]is[/i] possible.
translation: Stefanic: 我想那<u>是</u>有可能的。

original: Stefanic: Now that you mention it,[p/] I recall there being a way to reverse its effects.
translation: Stefanic: 你这么一说，[p/]我就想起来有一种方法可以逆转它的效果。

original: You never even considered that the [b]transmutation[/b] traces were left by an artificery tool.
translation: 你从没想过那些[b]形变术[/b]的痕迹是奥术能源工具留下的。

original: That [i]does[/i] lift some suspicion off of Aster...
translation: 这<u>确实</u>让阿斯特的嫌疑减轻了一些……

original: Celeste: Someone could have sabotaged the rail with the rod...
translation: Celeste: 有人可能用修复之杖破坏了栏杆……

original: Celeste: And they might have thrown it into the vat to cover their tracks...
translation: Celeste: 他们可能把它扔进桶里来掩盖自己的行踪……

original: Tyrion: ...But it didn't completely dissolve.
translation: Tyrion: ……但它没有完全溶解。

original: Tyrion: That would mean that they threw the rod in close to when Justin fell off of the walkway.
translation: Tyrion: 那就意味着他们在贾斯汀从走道上掉下去的时候把杖扔进去了。

original: Tyrion: It can't be a coincidence that these two events happened so close to each other.
translation: Tyrion: 这两件事发生得如此接近，不可能是巧合。

original: Celeste: ...And we still have no idea who actually broke the guard rail.
translation: Celeste: ……而且我们仍然不知道到底是谁破坏了护栏。

original: Celeste: We didn't find a second body in the vat.[p/] And we don't have evidence that proves a second victim even exists.
translation: Celeste: 我们在桶里没找到第二具尸体。[p/]而且我们也没有证据能证明存在第二个受害者。

original: Stefanic: I feel as if we have more questions than answers at the moment...
translation: Stefanic: 我觉得我们现在的问题比答案还多……

original: Tyrion: We've learned a few new facts about the case, though.
translation: Tyrion: 不过我们确实了解到了一些这个案子新的事实。

original: Tyrion: And the Inquisition has verified the traces of [b]transmutation[/b] on the guard rail.
translation: Tyrion: 裁判所已经证实了护栏上有[b]形变术[/b]的痕迹。

original: Tyrion: The burden of proof is still on the prosecution to prove that Dracogen is at fault.
translation: Tyrion: 证明德拉科根有过错的举证责任仍在检方。

original: Tyrion: Even if Steelwind has a proper explanation for that,[p/] I can counter her with the facts we've learned thus far.
translation: Tyrion: 即使斯蒂尔文德对此有合理的解释，[p/]我也可以用我们迄今为止了解到的事实来反驳她。

original: Stefanic: *sigh*[p/] I just hope that the trial goes as smoothly as you're describing.
translation: Stefanic: *叹气*[p/]我只希望审判能像你说的那样顺利进行。

original: It rarely ever does...[p/] But knowing that would just needlessly stress him out.
translation: 这种情况很少见……[p/]但知道这一点只会让他没必要地焦虑。

original: Stefanic: Regardless,[p/] I appreciate the work that you've done thus far.
translation: Stefanic: 不管怎样，[p/]我都很感谢你们迄今为止所做的工作。

original: Stefanic: I'll leave things in your very capable hands.
translation: Stefanic: 接下来的事情就交给你们了。

original: You just hope that you don't encounter any more curve balls tomorrow...
translation: 你只希望明天不要再遇到什么意外情况……

original: You arrive at the refinery and see that several knights from the Inquisition have already arrived.
translation: 你到达炼油厂，看到裁判所的几名骑士已经到了。

original: Orym: ...
translation: Orym: ……

original: You glance at the damaged walkway and see Commander White there with a few of his knights.
translation: 你瞥了一眼损坏的走道，看到怀特指挥官和几名骑士在那里。

original: He seems to notice you too.[p/] But he only pays you a passing glance.
translation: 他也似乎注意到了你。[p/]但他只是匆匆看了你一眼。

original: Stefanic: Oh, Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] I've been waiting for you.
translation: Stefanic: 噢，卡斯伯特先生。[p/]我一直在等你。

original: Stefanic: For quite a while,[p/] may I add.
translation: Stefanic: 而且，我得说，[p/]有一会了。

original: Tyrion: R-[p/]Right...[p/] Sorry about that...
translation: Tyrion: 好、[p/]好的……[p/]很抱歉……

original: Stefanic: I suppose you have your reasons.[p/] And you've more than proven yourself worthy of my trust.
translation: Stefanic: 我想你肯定有你的理由。[p/]而且你早就证明了自己值得我信任。

original: Stefanic: Although...
translation: Stefanic: 尽管……

original: Dracogen gives Aster a suspicious side glance.[p/] He appears to have come to the same conclusion that you did.
translation: 德拉科根斜着瞟了阿斯特一眼，眼神中满是怀疑。[p/]看起来他得出了和你一样的结论。

original: Stefanic: Well,[p/] you've given me little reason to doubt your judgment.
translation: Stefanic: 嗯，[p/]我没什么理由怀疑你的判断。

original: Stefanic: I will leave the investigation in your capable hands.
translation: Stefanic: 接下来的调查就拜托你了。

original: Celeste: Speaking of the investigation,[p/] where should we start first?
translation: Celeste: 说到调查，[p/]我们应该从哪里开始呢？

original: Tyrion: Now that we've gotten the Inquisition involved,[p/] we might be able to learn more about the magical traces at the crime scene.
translation: Tyrion: 既然已经有裁判所介入了，[p/]我们或许能更多地了解犯罪现场的魔法痕迹。

original: You look at Commander White,[p/] who is inspecting the walkway.
translation: 你看了看正在检查走道的怀特指挥官。

original: He's probably your best bet for getting more information about the investigation.
translation: 他可能是你获取更多调查信息的最佳人选。

original: Tyrion: From what Dracogen said,[p/] there shouldn't have been [i]any[/i] solid matter in those vats.
translation: Tyrion: 从德拉科根的话来看，那些大桶里本不该有<u>任何</u>固体物质。

original: Tyrion: We've already confirmed that the bone matter they found came from Justin's body.
translation: Tyrion: 我们已经确认了他们发现的骨头来自贾斯汀的身体。

original: Tyrion: But that leaves another question...
translation: Tyrion: 但那就有另一个问题了……

original: Tyrion: Where did those metallic shards come from?
translation: Tyrion: 那些金属碎片是哪来的？

original: No...[p/] The metallic shards weren't supposed to be in that vat.
translation: 不……[p/]金属碎片不应该出现在桶里。

original: So they [i]had[/i] to have come from somewhere...
translation: 它们<u>得</u>从其他地方来……

original: Tyrion: A metal object was thrown into the vat.
translation: Tyrion: 有金属物品被扔进了桶里。

original: Celeste: Yeah,[p/] I guess that makes sense.
translation: Celeste: 是，[p/]我想这样是说得通的。

original: Celeste: Whatever that object was,[p/] it probably dissolved into the shards that Orym found.
translation: Celeste: 不管那是什么物品，[p/]它多半被溶解成了奥蒙找到的金属碎片。

original: Tyrion: That's the thing though.
translation: Tyrion: 可问题就在这儿。

original: Tyrion: The magical liquid in the vat was extremely volatile.
translation: Tyrion: 桶里的魔法液体非常活泼。

original: Tyrion: It was destructive enough to reduce an entire human body to a few shards of bone.
translation: Tyrion: 它破坏力极强，足以把整个人体化为几片碎骨。

original: No...[p/] The magic in that liquid was strong enough to dissolve a human body in a matter of minutes.
translation: 不……[p/]那液体中的魔力强大到能在几分钟内溶解一个人体。

original: If that metal object had fallen in beforehand,[p/] [i]something[i/] should have happened to it.
translation: 如果金属物体在此之前掉进去了，[p/]它应该会发生<u>某种变化</u>。

original: Tyrion: The object would have been completely destroyed.
translation: Tyrion: 金属物体应该会被完全摧毁。

original: Tyrion: We shouldn't have found [i]any[/i] metal shards in the first place.
translation: Tyrion: 我们本不该发现<u>任何</u>金属碎片。

original: Celeste: Right...[p/] But we [i]did[/i] find them.
translation: Celeste: 是……[p/]但我们<u>确实</u>发现了。

original: Celeste: How do you explain that?
translation: Celeste: 你怎么解释呢？

original: Tyrion: That night something happened that prevented the metal object from being fully destroyed.
translation: Tyrion: 那天晚上发生了某种情况，阻止了金属物体被完全摧毁。

original: No...[p/] The magic in that liquid [i]was[/i] really powerful.
translation: 不……[p/]液体中的魔力<u>是</u>非常强大的。

original: But something happened recently that would have prevented it from destroying the metal object completely.
translation: 但很快发生了某种情况，阻止了它完全摧毁金属物体。

original: Tyrion: When Aster and Morrison reported the accident,[p/] the workers immediately neutralized the liquid's magic.
translation: Tyrion: 阿斯特和莫里森报告事故后，[p/]工人们立即中和了液体中的魔力。

original: Tyrion: They did this to attempt to save Justin.
translation: Tyrion: 他们这么做是为了尽力挽救贾斯汀。

original: Tyrion: But it would have also stopped the liquid from destroying anything else within the vat.
translation: Tyrion: 但这同时也阻止了液体继续摧毁桶内的其他东西。

original: Celeste: So [i]that's[/i] why we found those metal shards.
translation: Celeste: 所以<u>这就是</u>我们发现那些金属碎片的原因。

original: Tyrion: And whatever that metal object was,[p/] it was only partially destroyed.
translation: Tyrion: 不管那个金属物体是什么，[p/]它只是被部分摧毁了。

original: Tyrion: This means that it fell into the vat around the time that Justin fell into the vat.
translation: Tyrion: 这意味着它大约是在贾斯汀掉进桶里的时候掉进去的。

original: Tyrion: If it fell a while before the accident,[p/] it would have dissolved completely.
translation: Tyrion: 如果它是在事故发生很久前掉进去的，[p/]它应该会完全溶解掉。

original: Tyrion: And if it fell after the accident,[p/] it wouldn't have dissolved at all.
translation: Tyrion: 如果它是在事故发生后掉进去的，[p/]它根本就不会溶解。

original: Tyrion: Furthermore,[p/] whatever that object was,[p/] it was probably as large as Justin.
translation: Tyrion: 而且，[p/]不管那个物体是什么，[p/]它可能跟贾斯汀一样大。

original: Celeste: Do you think this metal object had something to do with the second victim?
translation: Celeste: 你觉得这个金属物体跟第二名受害者有关系吗？

original: Celeste: Maybe they were holding it when they fell in.
translation: Celeste: 也许他们在掉进去的时候正拿着它。

original: Tyrion: I'm not sure...[p/] But it's definitely possible.
translation: Tyrion: 我不确定……[p/]不过这绝对有可能。

original: Tyrion: We should take a closer look at the metallic shards that Commander White found.
translation: Tyrion: 我们应该仔细看看怀特指挥官发现的那些金属碎片。

original: Tyrion: Those shards might help us identify the second victim.
translation: Tyrion: 那些碎片或许能帮我们确定第二名受害者。

original: If that person even exists...
translation: 如果那个人真的存在……

original: Tyrion: A row of houses line the edge of the harbor.
translation: Tyrion: 一排房屋坐落在港口边缘。

original: Tyrion: When I was a kid,[p/] I always dreamed of saving up enough gold to buy my own house on the harbourfront...
translation: Tyrion: 小时候，[p/]我总是梦想着攒够金币，在港口边买套自己的房子……

original: Celeste: Well, you have a job as an attorney now.[p/] You can always move back here.
translation: Celeste: 你现在当律师了呀，[p/]随时可以搬回来嘛。

original: Tyrion: No...[p/] If possible,[p/] I never want to return to this city again.
translation: Tyrion: 不……[p/]如果可能的话，[p/]我再也不想回到这个城市了。

original: Celeste: ...
translation: Celeste: ……

original: Tyrion: It's a modest ship.[p/] It's probably used by local businesses to transport goods by sea.
translation: Tyrion: 这是一艘很普通的船，[p/]大概是当地商家用来在海上运输货物的。

original: Celeste: I can't help but feel nostalgic seeing these ships.
translation: Celeste: 看到这些船就会忍不住怀旧起来。

original: Celeste: I used to travel by sea all the time when I was traveling the world.
translation: Celeste: 我以前环游世界的时候，经常坐船。

original: Celeste: It was probably my favorite part.
translation: Celeste: 这大概是我最喜欢的部分。

original: Tyrion: Hm...[p/] That [i]does[/i] sound pretty nice.
translation: Tyrion: 嗯……[p/]那听起来<u>确实</u>不错。

original: Tyrion: I'd like to try riding one, one day.
translation: Tyrion: 有一天我也想试试坐船。

original: Celeste: Are you sure?[p/] You get motion sick pretty easily.
translation: Celeste: 你是认真的吗？[p/]你很容易晕船。

original: Celeste: Sailing on a ship might kill you.
translation: Celeste: 坐船可能会要了你的命。

original: She has a point there.
translation: 她在这一点上有道理。

original: Tyrion: There are several crates containing all kinds of goods.
translation: Tyrion: 有几箱装着各种货物的板条箱。

original: Tyrion: They must be the merchandise of the local businesses.
translation: Tyrion: 这肯定是当地商家的货物。

original: Tyrion: Dracogen told us that you witnessed the accident.
translation: Tyrion: 德拉科根跟我们说你目睹了那起事故。

original: Noah: Aye...[p/] It was a horrible thing what happened.
translation: Noah: 啊……[p/]发生的事情简直太恐怖了。

original: Noah: No one deserved what happened to that poor lad.
translation: Noah: 那个可怜的孩子不该遭受那样的事。

original: Celeste: Could you tell us what you saw?
translation: Celeste: 能告诉我们你看见了什么吗？

original: Noah: Well,[p/] I was showing a patron around town.
translation: Noah: 嗯，[p/]当时我正领着一位赞助商在城里逛。

original: Noah: And for some reason,[p/] he really wanted to take a look at the refinery.
translation: Noah: 出于某些原因，[p/]他很想参观一下炼油厂。

original: Noah: Something about checking out the local "art of fishery".
translation: Noah: 想看一看当地的“奥数冷鱼”。

original: He must mean "artificery".
translation: 他一定指的是“奥术能源”。

original: Noah: Anyways,[p/] he was looking at the machinery.
translation: Noah: 不管怎样，[p/]他当时正在看机器。

original: Noah: Then suddenly,[p/] Mosourika came running towards us.
translation: Noah: 突然间，[p/]莫苏里卡向我们跑来。

original: Noah: She was trying to tell us something.[p/] But the damn machines were too loud for us to hear her.
translation: Noah: 她当时想跟我们说些什么，[p/]但该死的机器太吵了，我们听不见。

original: Noah: After a while,[p/] she just pointed at the walkway.[p/] And we saw the horrible sight.
translation: Noah: 过了一会儿，[p/]她就指着走道，[p/]然后我们就看到了那可怕的场景。

original: Noah: We saw someone fall into the vat.
translation: Noah: 我们看到有人掉进了桶里。

original: Noah: By the time we could get them to stop the machines.[p/] It was too late.
translation: Noah: 等到我们喊人把机器停下来的时候，[p/]已经太迟了。

original: That matches up with what you know so far.
translation: 这和你目前所知的相符。

original: But what was Rika even [i]doing[/i] there?
translation: 但是里卡在那<u>做</u>什么呢？

original: She should have still been running the café at the time of the accident.
translation: 事故发生的时候她应该还在运营咖啡馆。

original: And that "patron" who was visiting the factory.[p/] Did they also witness the accident?
translation: 还有那位正在参观炼油厂的“赞助商”。[p/]他也目睹了事故吗？

original: Tyrion: Could you tell us how Justin fell off of the walkway?
translation: Tyrion: 你能告诉我们贾斯汀是怎么掉下走道的吗？

original: Tyrion: Was it because the guard rail broke under his weight?
translation: Tyrion: 是因为护栏在他的体重下断裂了吗？

original: Noah: Yeah, he did.[p/] But it [i]was[/i] a little strange.
translation: Noah: 是这样的。[p/]但这事<u>有点</u>奇怪。

original: Noah: That guard rail was made out of metal, yeah?
translation: Noah: 那个护栏是用金属做的，对吧？

original: Noah: But the way it broke...[p/] You would've thought that it was made out of cardboard.
translation: Noah: 但是它断裂的方式……[p/]你会觉得它是用纸牌做的。

original: Noah: He barely leaned on it,[p/] and it just broke apart.
translation: Noah: 他仅仅只是靠在上面，[p/]然后它就断了。

original: Even a poorly maintained guard rail shouldn't have broken that easily.
translation: 即使是没怎么保养的护栏也不应该这么轻松地断裂。

original: Did someone really use [b]transmutation[/b] magic to sabotage it?
translation: 真的有人用[b]形变术[/b]魔法来破坏它了吗？

original: If so,[p/] [i]that[/i] possibility could clear Dracogen's name.
translation: 如果是这样的话，[p/]<u>那种</u>可能性可以撇清德拉科根的嫌疑。

original: ...But presenting the possibility of a magical crime might just complicate things.
translation: ……但提出存在魔法犯罪的可能性或许只会让事情更复杂。

original: Tyrion: You mentioned that you were escorting a "patron" when the accident happened.
translation: Tyrion: 你提到过事件发生时你在护送一位“赞助商”。

original: Tyrion: Who was he?[p/] Did he witness the accident too?
translation: Tyrion: 他是谁？[p/]他也目睹了事故发生吗？

original: Noah: Aye.[p/] He was right there with me when Rika was trying to get our attention.
translation: Noah: 是的。[p/]里卡试图引起我们注意的时候，他就在我身边。

original: Noah: It'd be hard to miss it with the commotion she was making.
translation: Noah: 她闹得那么厉害，很难不注意到。

original: Noah: As for who he was...[p/] He said his name was "Aster".
translation: Noah: 至于他是谁……[p/]他说他的名字是“阿斯特”。

original: "Aster"...[p/] You don't know anyone by that name...
translation: "阿斯特"……[p/]你不认识任何叫这个名字的人。

original: But why does that name sound familiar?
translation: 但为什么这个名字听起来那么熟悉呢？

original: Tyrion: Do you know what his surname was?
translation: Tyrion: 你知道他的姓是什么吗？

original: Noah: No.[p/] The lad was really secretive with his last name for some reason.
translation: Noah: 不。[p/]他不知为何对自己的姓氏很保密。

original: He must've had a recognizable name…[p/] Is he a noble from a well-known house?
translation: 他一定有一个很容易认出的名字……[p/]难道他来自是一个来自知名家族的贵族？

original: Tyrion: Why were you escorting this "Aster" in the first place?[p/] Don't you have to manage the harbor?
translation: Tyrion: 为什么一开始你要护送这位“阿斯特”呢？[p/]难道你不需要管理港口吗？

original: Noah: Well, I can't really manage [i]anything[/i] 'cause of them.
translation: Noah: 唔，由于他们我几乎<u>什么事</u>也管不了。

original: He gestures towards the Inquisition knights crowding the pier.
translation: 他指了指围在码头的裁判所骑士。

original: Noah: They've blocked all sea travel out of the city 'till this mess is sorted out.
translation: Noah: 他们封锁了所有通过海运出城的路径，直到这个烂摊子解决。

original: Celeste: They have a lot of knights investigating the harbor.[p/] Do you know what they're looking for?
translation: Celeste: 有很多骑士在调查港口。[p/]你知道他们在找什么吗？

original: Noah: ...Well,[p/] you didn't hear this from me.
translation: Noah: ……好吧，[p/]记住我从没和你说过这些。

original: Noah: But according to them,[p/] Aster's ship just up and vanished in the dead of night.
translation: Noah: 但据他们所说，[p/]阿斯特的船在夜深人静的时候突然消失了。

original: Tyrion: "Vanished"?[p/] As in someone hijacked it?
translation: Tyrion: “消失”？[p/]意思是有人劫持了船？

original: Noah: That's the thing.[p/] The guards would have [i]noticed[/i] if someone had driven off with the ship.[p/] Especially one of that size.
translation: Noah: 问题就在这。[p/]如果船被人开走，卫兵肯定会<u>注意到</u>。[p/]尤其它是那种体型的船。

original: Noah: From what I heard,[p/] one of the guards could have sworn that they saw it vanish in a flash of light.
translation: Noah: 就我听说的，[p/]其中有个卫兵发誓说他看到船是在一道突然的闪光后消失的。

original: Celeste: A flash of light...[p/] Like something created by a spell.
translation: Celeste: 闪光……[p/]听起来像是法术造成的现象。

original: Tyrion: What kind of ship was it?[p/] Do you know how big it was?
translation: Tyrion: 那是艘什么船？[p/]你知道船有多大吗？

original: Noah: From the size of it,[p/] I'd say that it was probably a galleon.
translation: Noah: 根据它的尺寸，[p/]我敢说它应该是艘大帆船。

original: A galleon?![p/] A spell of that scale would have to be pretty powerful to affect a ship of that size.
translation: 一艘大帆船？！[p/]能影响到这种尺寸船的大规模法术肯定很强大。

original: Celeste: I wonder who this "Aster" person is...
translation: Celeste: 我想知道这个叫“阿斯特”的人到底是谁……

original: Celeste: He must be high profile if they're calling in the Kingsguard [i]and[/i] the Inquisition for him.
translation: Celeste: 如果能到为了找他而调动国王卫队<u>和</u>裁判所的程度，这人肯定地位不低。

original: All over a missing a ship...
translation: 全都是因为一艘船的失踪……

original: Tyrion: You spent some time with him.[p/] Am I correct, Morrison?
translation: Tyrion: 你和他曾经同行过一段时间。[p/]我说的对吗，莫里森？

original: Tyrion: Did he tell you where he was staying?
translation: Tyrion: 他有没有告诉你他住在哪？

original: Noah: If I remember right,[p/] he's staying at the local inn near the town square.
translation: Noah: 如果我没记错，[p/]他住在城广场附近的一家旅馆里。

original: Celeste: Wait...[p/][s/] That's the tavern that [i]we[/i] were staying at!
translation: Celeste: 等等……[p/][s/]那不就是<u>我们</u>之前住过的旅馆！

original: Tyrion: If he's [i]this[/i] high profile,[p/] why is he staying at an inn for commoners?
translation: Tyrion: 如果他的地位<u>如此</u>高，[p/]为什么他要住在一家平民旅馆里？

original: Noah: No idea.[p/] He's an eccentric one for sure.
translation: Noah: 不知道。[p/]他确实是个怪人。

original: Whoever he is,[p/] he also witnessed the accident.[p/] You'll definitely want to speak with him.
translation: 不管他是谁，[p/]他也目击了事故发生的过程。[p/]你肯定想去和他谈谈。

original: And if he's a noble,[p/] there's a chance that [i]he's[/i] the mage that sabotaged the guard rail...
translation: 而且如果他是贵族，[p/]那么有可能<u>他就是</u>那个破坏护栏的法师……

original: Noah: Ah, I can still remember the days when you were just a small boy.
translation: Noah: 啊，我还记得你还是个小男孩的时候呢。

original: Noah: You've really grown up since then.
translation: Noah: 你现在真的长大了。

original: You had to.[p/] There was no other choice.
translation: 你必须长大。[p/]没有别的选择。

original: Noah: By the way,[p/] you haven't introduced me to your friend over here.
translation: Noah: 顺便提一下，[p/]你还没给我介绍那边你的朋友呢。

original: Tyrion: Oh, right.
translation: Tyrion: 噢，是的。

original: Tyrion: Morrison,[p/] this is Celeste McCoy:[p/] my bodyguard.
translation: Tyrion: 莫里森，[p/]这位是塞莱斯特·麦考伊：[p/]我的贴身护卫。

original: Noah: Bodyguard, huh?[p/] When I first saw you two,[p/] I thought she was your-
translation: Noah: 贴身护卫，是吗？[p/]我第一次见到你俩的时候，[p/]我还以为她是你的——

original: Tyrion: N-[p/][s/]No![p/] It's not like that.[p/] Our relationship is purely professional.
translation: Tyrion: 没、[p/][s/]没有！[p/]不是那样的，[p/]我们只是纯粹的职业关系。

original: Celeste: "Professional"?[p/] How could you say that after we shared a room together?
translation: Celeste: “职业”？[p/]在我们一起睡过一间房后你怎么还能这么说?

original: Noah: ...
translation: Noah: ……

original: Tyrion: C-[p/]Can you not?
translation: Tyrion: 难、[p/]难道你不能吗？

original: Celeste: Sorry.[p/] You make it so easy sometimes.
translation: Celeste: 不好意思。[p/]有时候你真是让人省心。

original: Tyrion: Rika seems to be doing well.
translation: Tyrion: 里卡看起来状况不错。

original: Tyrion: Her café looks pretty busy.
translation: Tyrion: 她的咖啡馆看起来很忙。

original: Noah: Aye.[p/] I'm happy to see you kids are making something of yourselves.
translation: Noah: 是。[p/]看到你们这些孩子有出息，我很高兴。

original: Noah: With the way people treat mages,[p/] I was really worried for her future.
translation: Noah: 鉴于人们对法师的态度，[p/]我真的很担心她的未来。

original: Tyrion: The Dracogen Trading Company seems to have a large presence in Aurinax now.
translation: Tyrion: 德拉科根贸易公司在奥瑞纳克斯似乎势力很大。

original: Noah: Aye.[p/] Ol' Dracogen just swooped in one day and took the city straight from von Sanctus' grip.
translation: Noah: 是的。[p/]老德拉科根有一天突然出现，从冯·桑克图斯手中夺走了这座城市。

original: Noah: Now, I can't think of a single business here that [i]isn't[/i] working with them.
translation: Noah: 现在，我想不到这里有什么企业是<u>不</u>跟他们合作的。

original: You wonder how Lord von Sanctus feels about that.
translation: 你琢磨着冯·桑克图斯勋爵会对此怎么想。

original: Noah: I hope this whole mess doesn't affect the Company's dealings here.
translation: Noah: 我希望这整件事不会影响到公司在这里的生意。

original: Noah: He really breathes life into this town.
translation: Noah: 他真是给这个城市带来了生机。

original: Tyrion: Morrison,[p/] do you know about a criminal named "the Eyetaker"?
translation: Tyrion: 莫里森，[p/]你知道有个叫“夺眼者”的罪犯吗？

original: Noah: The Eyetaker?![p/][s/] W-[p/]where did you hear that name?!
translation: Noah: 夺眼者？！[p/][s/]你、[p/]你从哪听到这个名字的？！

original: Tyrion: So, you [i]do[/i] know about them.
translation: Tyrion: 所以，你<u>确实</u>知道他。

original: Noah: Aye, [i/] I do.
translation: Noah: <u>是</u>。

original: Noah: I've learned to keep my distance from him over the years.
translation: Noah: 这些年来，我学会了跟他保持距离。

original: Noah: The Eyetaker is the criminal kingpin of this region.
translation: Noah: “夺目者”是这一带的犯罪头目。

original: Noah: Every large criminal undertaking in this region happens under his watch.
translation: Noah: 这一带所有的大型犯罪活动都在他的掌控之下。

original: Tyrion: He's [i]that[/i] big of a deal?
translation: Tyrion: 他有<u>那么</u>厉害吗？

original: Noah: Of course, he is!
translation: Noah: 那当然！

original: Noah: More importantly,[p/] how did [i]you[/i] hear about him?!
translation: Noah: 更重要的是，[p/]你是怎么听说他的？！

original: Tyrion: From what I heard,[p/] Justin Waye owed him a huge debt.
translation: Tyrion: 我听说，[p/]贾斯汀·维耶欠了他一大笔债。

original: Noah: [i]Justin[/i] owed them?!
translation: Noah: <u>贾斯汀·维耶</u>欠他债？！

original: Noah: I knew he used to run around with a bunch of rogues,[p/] but I never imagined...
translation: Noah: 我知道他以前跟一帮流氓混在一起，[p/]但我从没想到……

original: Noah: By the Scaled Lord...
translation: Noah: 鳞甲领主在上……

original: Tyrion: The Eyetaker [i]might[/i] be involved in Justin's death.
translation: Tyrion: “夺目者”<u>可能</u>跟贾斯汀的死有关。

original: Tyrion: Do you think someone like him could be behind this?
translation: Tyrion: 你觉得他这样的的人会是幕后人物吗？

original: Noah: Well...[p/] There's a saying we have about what happens when you get on his bad side...
translation: Noah: 呃……[p/]关于招惹他会有啥下场，我们这儿有个说法……

original: Noah: Let's just say...[p/] He reminds you of why he has that name.
translation: Noah: 简单说吧……[p/]他会让你明白他为啥有这个名字。

original: Tyrion: How do you feel about Lord von Sanctus?
translation: Tyrion: 你觉得冯·桑克图斯勋爵怎么样？

original: Noah: Hah.[p/] You know the answer as well as I.
translation: Noah: 哈。[p/]你跟我一样清楚答案是什么。

original: Noah: I've got no love for that damn aristocrat.
translation: Noah: 我一点儿都不喜欢那个该死的贵族。

original: Noah: If we're lucky,[p/] ol' Dracogen will shoot down this civil suit and kick von Sanctus to the curb.
translation: Noah: 要是运气好，[p/]老德拉科根会驳回这起民事诉讼，把冯·桑克图斯踢到一边去。

original: Tyrion: What can you tell us about this, Morrison?
translation: Tyrion: 你能跟我们讲讲这件事吗，莫里森？

original: Noah: Ah...[p/] Sorry.[p/] I don't know much about those sorts of things.
translation: Noah: 啊……[p/]对不起，[p/]我对这类事情不太了解。

original: Noah: You'd better ask someone else.
translation: Noah: 你最好问问其他人。

original: [character name=""][/character]You arrive at the harbour,[p/] in search of Morrison: the harbourmaster.
translation: [character name=""][/character]你来到港口，[p/]寻找港务长莫里森。

original: However,[p/] you notice a large concentration of knights in the shipping area.
translation: 然而，[p/]你注意到装运区聚集了大量骑士。

original: Notably,[p/] the Arcane Inquisition is among them.
translation: 值得注意的是，[p/]奥术裁判所也在其中。

original: You spot Commander White and Prosecutor Steelwind coordinating the knights there.
translation: 你看到怀特指挥官和斯蒂尔文德检察官正在那里指挥骑士们。

original: Celeste: I wonder what those two are doing here.
translation: Celeste: 我想知道他们俩在这做什么。

original: Tyrion: The knights at the blockade said that they were investigating something...
translation: Tyrion: 封锁线的骑士们说他们正在调查点什么……

original: Tyrion: There must be magic involved if the Inquisition is here.
translation: Tyrion: 既然裁判所来了，肯定跟魔法有关。

original: Celeste: ...Do you think this has anything to do with what happened to Justin?
translation: Celeste: ……你觉得这跟贾斯汀的事有关系吗？

original: Tyrion: I doubt it.[p/] We didn't see any Inquisition knights at the refinery.
translation: Tyrion: 我觉得没有。[p/]我们在炼油厂没有见到任何裁判所骑士。

original: Tyrion: It must just be a coincidence.
translation: Tyrion: 这一定只是巧合。

original: Celeste: Hm...[p/] You're probably right.
translation: Celeste: 嗯……[p/]你大概是对的。

original: Celeste: But I'm kind of curious about what the Inquisition is investigating.
translation: Celeste: 但我有点好奇裁判所在调查的东西。

original: Tyrion: It has nothing to do with our case.
translation: Tyrion: 这跟我们的案子没关系。

original: Tyrion: It'd be best to leave them to their business.
translation: Tyrion: 最好别去打扰他们。

original: Celeste: Alright...
translation: Celeste: 好吧……

original: Noah: Oi,[p/] You there.
translation: Noah: 嘿，[p/]那边的家伙。

original: Noah: You'd best clear out.
translation: Noah: 你最好赶紧离开。

original: Noah: The knights have closed the harbor.
translation: Noah: 骑士们已经关闭港口了。

original: Tyrion: ...Morrison?
translation: Tyrion: ……莫里森？

original: Noah: ...Huh?[p/] Do I know you?
translation: Noah: ……啊？[p/]我认识你吗？

original: Noah: ...
translation: Noah: ……

original: Noah: Wait...[p/][s/] Cuthbert?![p/][s/] Is that you?!
translation: Noah: 等等……[p/][s/]卡斯伯特？！[p/][s/]是你吗？！

original: Tyrion: H-[p/]Hi...
translation: Tyrion: 你、[p/]你好……

original: Noah: I [i]heard[/i] from little Mosourika that you were back in town!
translation: Noah: 我从小莫苏里卡那儿<u>听说</u>你回城里了！

original: Noah: What can I do for you?
translation: Noah: 我有什么能帮忙的吗？

original: Tyrion: We heard that you were at the refinery yesterday.
translation: Tyrion: 我们听说你昨天在炼油厂。

original: Tyrion: From what we heard,[p/] you witnessed the accident.
translation: Tyrion: 据我们听说，[p/]你目睹了那起事故。

original: Tyrion: We wanted to ask you some questions about what you saw.
translation: Tyrion: 我们想问问你看到的情况。

original: Noah: Oh...[p/] right.[p/] Mosourika mentioned that you're an attorney now.
translation: Noah: 噢……[p/]好的。[p/]莫苏里卡提到你现在是名律师了。

original: Noah: ...
translation: Noah: ……

original: Tyrion: ...What?
translation: Tyrion: ……什么？

original: Noah: I just hope you're still not hung up over that business with your mother.
translation: Noah: 我只是希望你还在为跟你母亲的那档子事耿耿于怀。

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Noah: S-[p/]Sorry...[p/] I guess it's none of my business.
translation: Noah: 对、[p/]对不起……[p/]我想这跟我没有关系。

original: Noah: A-[p/]Anyways,[p/] I'll tell you what I know.
translation: Noah: 总、[p/]总之，[p/]我会告诉你我知道的事情。

original: So, you know who the Eyetaker is now.
translation: 所以，你现在知道谁是夺眼者了。

original: It definitely adds another angle to this case.
translation: 这给这个案子提供了另一个角度。

original: But there are still some elements of this that don't make sense.
You need to take some time to work through it all.
But you should go talk to Dracogen first.[p/] He'll want to see everything that you've found.
Frey: I'm sorry, Tyrion...
Frey: There were so many things that I wanted to tell you.[p/] So many things that I wanted to show you.
Frey: But I'm afraid that I can't do that now...
Frey: I need you to be strong now.
Frey: This world is bleak,[p/] merciless,[p/] and unforgiving.
Frey: But I've seen you.[p/] I know how bright the light within you is.
Frey: Use my eyes.[p/] Peer beyond the Divine Gate as I once did.
Frey: Use it to reclaim the future.
Lloyd: Preposterous![p/][s/] Completely and [i]utterly[/i] preposterous!
Tyrion: Is something wrong, Lord von Sanctus?
Lloyd: You [i]filthy[/i] rat![p/][s/] You cheated, didn't you?!
Lloyd: That's right![p/][s/] You're just a cheat![p/][s/] A cheat and a charlatan!
Tyrion: ...Do you have any evidence to prove that ridiculous claim?
Lloyd: I mastered chess before you could [i]crawl[/i] out of whatever [i]rat-hole[/i] you came from!
Lloyd: Do you honestly expect anyone to believe that [i]you[/i][p/] could defeat [i]me[/i]?!
Tyrion: Honestly,[p/] I'm just as disappointed as you are.
Tyrion: I was expecting more of a challenge from House von Sanctus.
Tyrion: ...But I suppose all the gold in the world can't buy you a modicum of skill.
Lloyd: You little upstart![p/][s/] I'll-
Nobleman: [i]*Ahem*[/i]
Von Sanctus' acquaintance clears his throat and gestures subtly to the crowd of spectators.
Everyone's attention is on him.[p/] And you can see the crowd muttering amongst themselves.
His undignified behavior probably isn't doing any favors for his public image.
Realizing himself,[p/] he tries to regain his composure.
Lloyd: Hmph…[p/] It's preposterous…
He walks away,[p/] muttering the word "preposterous" under his breath a few more times.
It sounds like he's trying to reassure himself more than anyone else.
Celeste: So...[p/] That was...[p/] something.
Tyrion: Yeah.[p/] I knew that he'd get angry.[p/] But I didn't expect him to make a scene like that.
Celeste: Well...[p/] You [i]did[/i] insult him.
Celeste: Not to say that he didn't deserve it.
Tyrion: Come on.[p/] I love seeing these conceited nobles lose their minds when I beat them.
Tyrion: It's half of the fun of playing these tournaments.
Celeste: Wow...[p/] Where's this confidence when we're in the courthouse?
Tyrion: That's...
Tyrion: Court cases are different.
Tyrion: I have to deal with real-world elements during a trial.[p/] And that [i]includes[/i] Prosecutor Steelwind.
Celeste: Prosecutor Steelwind, huh?
Celeste: I wonder if [i]she[/i] plays chess.
Now [i]there's[/i] a thought.
You wonder if she'd be willing to play against you sometime.
She can't be any worse than these pampered nobles.
Celeste: Anyways, we should celebrate somewhere in town!
Celeste: Even if he [i]was[/i] a pushover,[p/][s/] you just beat one of the top-ranked chess players in the kingdom!
Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: To be honest,[p/] you had your reservations about returning to the city of Aurinax.
If you weren't facing one of the four pillars,[p/] you would have never come back here.
You'd rather leave this city as soon as possible.
Celeste: I saw a café while we were walking around.
Celeste: The food smelled great![p/][s/] I'd really like to go there!
Tyrion: ...We could always go to one of the cafés in the capital.[p/] There are plenty of places to choose from there.
Celeste: Trust me.[p/] I've traveled around the world.
Celeste: There's nothing better than food from a thriving port city.
Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Tyrion: ...Alright,[p/] I suppose there's no harm in staying a little longer.
She [i]does[/i] have a point.[p/] The city streets seem livelier than when you last saw them.
You see a lot of businesses that weren't here before.[p/] And they all seem to be very well off.
Despite being a port city,[p/] Aurinax used to look like a ghost town.
Has the local nobility been investing in the city?
...You find [i]that[/i] possibility very hard to believe.
You arrive at the café that Celeste told you about.
As you enter,[p/] you're struck by a powerful aroma of freshly baked pastries and coffee.
The scent of the baked goods swirls around you.[p/] You take a moment to inhale the enticing smells.
You have to admit that it's making you very hungry.
Mosourika: So…[p/] You seek to enter the domain of the death-bringer songstress.
Mosourika: Well,[p/] if glory is what you seek,[p/][s/] then look no further!
Mosourika: For you stand before Mosourika Tudor:[p/][s/] Dark Lord of Aurinax!
As you head further into the café,[p/] you're approached by a familiar face.
Tyrion: ...!
translation: Tyrion: ……！

original: Tyrion: ...Rika?[p/] Is that you?
Mosourika: Ha![p/][s/] It appears that my reputation precedes me!
Mosourika: How good of you to-...!
Mosourika: ...
Mosourika: Wait,[p/] you're-...[p/][s/] Tyrion?!
Mosourika: Y-[p/]You're...[p/][s/] You're back!
Tyrion: ...H-[p/]Hi.
Mosourika: You...
Mosourika: Why didn't you tell anyone that you were back in town?!
Mosourika: Do you have any idea how [i]worried[/i] we've all been?!
Celeste: Um...[p/] Do you two know each other?
Tyrion: R-[p/]Right...
Tyrion: Celeste,[p/] this is Mosourika Tudor.
Tyrion: I was friends with her when I lived here many years ago...
Celeste: Wait...[p/][s/] You used to live here?
Tyrion: ...Yeah.[p/] Aurinax is actually the town I grew up in.
Celeste: What?![p/][s/] But you were in such a hurry to leave before!
Mosourika: ...
Mosourika: ...You came here to eat, right?
Mosourika: If you're still hungry,[p/] I can bring you some of our best dishes,[p/] on the house.
Tyrion: N-[p/]No.[p/] I couldn't possibly-
Mosourika: Come on![p/] Don't be like that.
Mosourika: It's been years since I've seen you.
Mosourika: And you [i]know[/i] how good my food is.
Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Tyrion: Okay,[p/] but only for a little while.
Rika sets a table for the three of you and calls over a waiter.
You all place your orders.
Mosourika: Now, tell me everything.
Mosourika: I want to know all about what you've been doing since you left.
Mosourika: Tyrion, I [i]really[/i] don't know anything.
Tyrion: After what I've heard...[p/] I find that hard to believe.
Mosourika: Well,[p/] you'll have to do better than [i]that[/i] if you want to defeat me!
It's difficult to argue with her when she gets like this.
OK
Mosourika Tudor appears to be hiding something from you.
She clearly knows about the "bad crowd" that Justin fell in with.[p/] But she's hiding who they are and where you can find them.
You'll need to convince her to share that information with you.
Yes
No
Tyrion: Rika,[p/] you know about Justin's friends, don't you?
Tyrion: Just be honest with me.
Mosourika: I-[p/][s/]I'm not hiding anything!
Mosourika: I really don't know that much about him.
Mosourika: I may have delivered his food,[p/] but he was just a customer to me.
Tyrion: I [i]might[/i] have believed that you delivered his food because he was a good customer.
Tyrion: But that wasn't [i]all[/i] you did for him.
Tyrion: You saw that he was trying to turn his life around.
Tyrion: And you begged Dracogen to set him up with a job.
Tyrion: You wouldn't do that for a customer that you barely knew.
Mosourika: Hrk!
Tyrion: Rika,[p/] you clearly know more about Justin than you're letting on.
Tyrion: And [i]this[/i] proves it.
Mosourika: Uh...[p/] I don't think [i]that[/i] really proves anything.
Tyrion: O-[p/]Oh...
Rika is trying to say that she wasn't close to Justin.
But one of the things that she did for him contradicts that.
Mosourika: W-[p/]Well,[p/] [i]that[/i] still proves nothing.
Mosourika: I am Mosourika Tudor,[p/][s/] High Archmage of the Cadmium Flame!
Mosourika: Is it so hard to believe that I took pity on a stranger?
Mosourika: It would only be right for me to equip a commoner with the means to change his life!
Doubt [d="You're not a very good liar, Rika. You would have risked a lot by asking Dracogen to hire a stranger."/]
Tyrion: You're not a good liar, Rika.
Tyrion: You would have risked a lot by asking Dracogen to hire a stranger.[p/] Especially a stranger with a dubious past like Justin.
Tyrion: What if Justin fell back into his old ways?
Tyrion: That would have surely brought about consequences on you [i]and[/i] your business.
Tyrion: You wouldn't take a risk like that unless you [i]knew[/i] him well enough to trust him.
Mosourika: ...
Agree [d="You are a generous person, Rika. And that type of generosity would make you privy to details of Justin's life."/]
Tyrion: You [i]are[/i] a generous person, Rika.
Tyrion: And that type of generosity would make you privy to details of Justin's life.
Tyrion: I doubt that he'd continue to hide his past from you after you'd done so much for him.
Tyrion: You [i]would[/i] have known who he associated with.
Mosourika: Tyrion...[p/] Not everyone wants to share their past with the people close to them.
Mosourika: ...You should know that better than anyone.
...She's got you there.
Rationalize [d="You said earlier that he was a good person. How could you possibly know that if you didn't know him well?"/]
Tyrion: You said earlier that he was a good person.[p/] And that he fell in with a "bad crowd".
Tyrion: How could you possibly know that if you didn't know him well?
Mosourika: There are plenty of people who would have said that about him.
Mosourika: He didn't exactly keep it secret.[p/] I only knew about him because of rumors that were floating around town.
...That does make sense.[p/] Could she be telling the truth?
No...[p/] When you read her thoughts earlier,[p/] you could tell that she was hiding something.
She has to be lying right now.
Mosourika: Okay, fine![p/] I guess we [i]were[/i] friends.
Mosourika: But like I said before,[p/] he was trying to leave his old life behind.
Mosourika: He didn't like talking about the person he was back then.
Mosourika: He wanted to forget about it.[p/] And I never brought it up.
Tyrion: I doubt that, Rika.
Tyrion: In fact,[p/] I'm sure that you were friends for at least a few years.
Tyrion: With a friendship that old,[p/] I'm sure he would have confided in you about his past.
Celeste: ...W-[p/]What?
...No.[p/] You need to stay focused.
Tyrion: Rika,[p/] your statement doesn’t match with what you’re thinking.
Mosourika: What I'm "thinking"?[p/] What's [i]that[/i] supposed to mean?
Tyrion: E-[p/]Er,[p/] well…
You can’t exactly [i]tell[/i] her that you're reading her thoughts…
Tyrion: Rika,[p/] I don't know why you thought you had to lie about this.
Tyrion: But I need to talk to Justin's former friends.
Mosourika: ...Is that really necessary?
Tyrion: Yes.[p/] I need to know why he was behaving so strangely before the accident.
Tyrion: His friends might know something about him that you and Dracogen don't.
Mosourika: But that doesn't make any sense.
Mosourika: I think you're just overthinking this, Tyrion.
You didn't want to overplay your hand before.[p/] But it looks like you don't have a choice now.
Tyrion: Rika,[p/] Justin told you that he was heading to a scheduled meeting in Dracogen's office.
Tyrion: But according to Dracogen,[p/] Justin wasn't even supposed to be in the refinery building yesterday.
Mosourika: ...What?
Tyrion: Rika...[p/] Justin might have lied to you.
Mosourika: N-[p/]No...
Mosourika: He would [i]never[/i] do that!
Tyrion: I need to know why he was up there.
Tyrion: And so far,[p/] the statements that I've gotten from you [i]and[/i] Dracogen don't explain that.
Mosourika: ...
Tyrion: I need to talk to people who might know things about him that you don't.
Mosourika: ...Okay.
Mosourika: I'll tell you where you can find them...
Mosourika: ...Just promise me that you'll be safe, okay?
You’ve successfully persuaded Mosourika Tudor.
Tyrion: Rika,[p/] he was acting very strangely.
Tyrion: I need to talk to Justin's former friends so they can explain [i]this[/i].
Mosourika: I-[p/]I don't understand.
Mosourika: How would talking to his former friends explain that?
Tyrion: O-[p/]Oh... I-[p/]I...
You might want to PRESENT something else to prove your point.
Tyrion: So...[p/] Is it just me,[p/] or does this hallway look similar to the one in your family's tavern?
Celeste: Well,[p/] most taverns use the same architecture.[p/] So, I don't think it's [i]that[/i] strange.
Tyrion: No,[p/] but it looks [i]exactly[/i] like the McCoy Tavern.[p/] It's uncanny.
Tyrion: It's as if whoever made this tavern decided to just reuse the same design.
Celeste: Hey,[p/] making unique designs is difficult, Tyrion.[p/] [i]And[/i] it costs money.
Celeste: Do you really think developers should be spending resources on a location that you'll only see once?
Tyrion: I don't know...[p/] It just seems kind of lazy.
Celeste: Well if it bothers you so much,[p/][s/] why don't [i]you[/i] pay for the assets required to make a new one?

Noah: She pointed at the walkway.[p/] And that's when we saw someone fall into the vat.
Noah: By the time we could get them to stop the machines.[p/] It was too late.
And then there's Aster's account of events.
Tyrion: Did you see the expression on his face?[p/] He might have been unconscious.
Aster: I'm afraid I couldn't see [i]anything[/i] on his face.
Aster: It was much too dark to make out his features.
Tyrion: Wait, you didn't actually [i]see[/i] his face?

Aster: Well...[p/] Who [i]else[/i] could it have been?
Aster and Morrison couldn't see Justin's face.
That one detail of their testimonies never sat right with you.
But you dismissed your suspicions.[p/] They found Justin's body in the vat, after all.
You know for a fact that [i]he[/i] fell into that vat.
But you never considered one other possibility...
Justin survived the accident.
translation: 贾斯汀从事故中生还了。

original: Could Justin have survived the accident?
No...[p/] He was drenched in several corrosive and volatile chemicals.

It's unfortunate...[p/] But Justin definitely didn't survive.
Another person fell into the vat.

original: Justin didn't fall into the vat.
translation: 贾斯汀没有掉进桶里。

original: Is it possible that Justin [i]didn't[/i] fall into the vat?
No...[p/] Rika testified that she saw him fall off of the walkway.
If he had somehow climbed back up,[p/] someone would have seen him leave the refinery.
And if he'd fallen onto the ground,[p/] that [i]definitely[/i] would have left evidence behind.
Another person...?[p/][s/] Is that really possible?!
But...[p/] It's the only thing that makes sense.
It would also explain how Rika, Morrison, and Aster all saw someone fall off of the walkway at different times.
But then...[p/][s/] Who is this second person?!
Ugh...[p/] You don't have a choice.
Even if you don't know all of the facts,[p/] this is the only conclusion you can draw.
Judge: I think you've had [i]quite[/i] enough time to deliberate, Mr. Cuthbert.

Tyrion: But they are both telling the truth.

Tyrion: However,[p/] Mr. Morrison and his companion did [i]not[/i] know the victim personally.[p/] They could barely make out his features.
Tyrion: They only assumed that it was him [i]after[/i] learning that he fell in.
Aria: Please.

Mosourika: N-[p/]No![p/][s/] I'm sure I saw Justin tumble [i]over[/i] the guard rail.

Judge: This is a civil case, Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] Not some murder mystery for you to throw wild theories towards.

No…[p/] That’s not right.

The guard rails broke when Justin put his weight on them.
So, what did this [b]transmutation[/b] spell [i]do[/i] to the guard rails [i]before[/i] Justin fell?
Tyrion: Right.[p/] Someone used a [b]transmutation[/b] spell to weaken the guard rails.
Tyrion: Afterwards,[p/] the guard rails were so weak that Justin accidentally broke them.
Celeste: And only [i]these[/i] guard rails were weakened.
Celeste: The sabotaged rails are right next to this vat of corrosive chemicals, too.
Tyrion: There was a clear intention behind the actions of this unknown mage.
Tyrion: Judging by what happened,[p/] that intention can only be one thing.
No...[p/] [i]Only[/i] the guard rails in front of this vat were sabotaged.
The unknown mage who did this must have had a clear intention when doing this.
They were trying to make a specific series of events occur.
Tyrion: ...Whoever sabotaged the guard rail [i]wanted[/i] someone to fall into the vat.
Tyrion: Why else would they only target those specific guard rails?
Celeste: But...[p/][s/] why?![p/][s/] Who would do this?!
You can feel your fist clenching tightly.
Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Someone committed murder using magic here...
And whoever did this had the [i]gall[/i] to try to cover it up!
Celeste: T-[p/]Tyrion...?
You won't forgive whoever did this...
When you're through with them,[p/] you will make them feel a [i]fraction[/i] of the misery that your mother-
Celeste: Tyrion!
Tyrion: W-[p/]What...?
Celeste: Are you okay?
Tyrion: R-[p/]Right...[p/] Sorry...
Tyrion: A-[p/]Anyways, [p/]if it weren't for your [b]Detect Magic[/b],[p/] everyone would have written this off as an accident.
Tyrion: Magical traces are only detectable for forty-eight hours after a mage casts a spell.
Tyrion: That means that whoever cast the [b]transmutation[/b] spell, did so recently.
Celeste: R-[p/]Right...
Tyrion: It's the broken guard rail.[p/] The entire case hinges on finding out when and how this railing broke.
Tyrion: If Justin Waye didn't break the guard rail,[p/] then who did?
Tyrion: If the liquid is so volatile,[p/] how were you able to take things [i]out[/i] of the vat?
Aster: Oh,[p/] the liquid isn't volatile [i]anymore[/i].
Aster: When the harbourmaster and I reported what we saw,[p/] the workers poured some sort of alchemical solution into the vat.
Orym: Yeah.[p/] According to them,[p/] that solution neutralized the [b]evocation[/b] magic in those chemicals.
Orym: From what I hear,[p/] the magical liquid in these vats is usually blue.
Orym: The solution that they poured in turned it green.
Aster: Yes.[p/] Unfortunately,[p/] it was too late.
Aster: By the time they'd neutralized the liquid,[p/] Justin's body had already mostly dissolved.
Orym: And if they hadn't neutralized it so quickly,[p/] we probably wouldn’t have found [i]anything[/i] from the victim.
Celeste: The traces of [b]transmutation[/b] are still here.
Tyrion: It's been a day since the accident...
Tyrion: If these traces were left two days ago,[p/] these traces [i]should[/i] disappear by tomorrow.
Celeste: Right...[p/] Magical traces are only detectable for 48 hours after a spell is cast.
Celeste: There are traces of [b]evocation[/b] magic on the chemicals in these vats.
Tyrion: That makes sense.[p/] [b]Evocation[/b] is the school of magic for spells that create and disperse energy.
Tyrion: These chemicals probably induce some sort of magical reaction to create Arcane Crystals.
Tyrion: We already took a look at the metallic shards.
Tyrion: And we found one shard with the von Sanctus crest on it.
Tyrion: We'll probably have to look elsewhere if we want to find out where it came from.
Tyrion: Commander White.[p/] You mentioned that you found several metallic shards in the vat.
Tyrion: Do you mind if we take a look at them?
Orym: Sure.[p/] Just don't get any bright ideas about taking anything.
Orym: ...You'll also want to avoid touching them with your bare hands.
Orym: The liquid is neutralized...[p/] But it definitely ain't good for your skin.
The commander motions to one of the Inquisition knights.
After a few moments,[p/] he brings back a large barrel filled with metallic shards.
Celeste: What?[p/][s/] There were [i]that[/i] many?!
What could have possibly fallen into the vat?
Tyrion: Well...[p/] I guess we should get started.
Celeste: Ugh...
You spend some time closely inspecting the metallic shards with Celeste.
The shards are only the size of small rocks.[p/] And it's difficult to find any discerning features.
Tyrion: ...Any luck on your end?
Celeste: No...[p/] I haven't found-...
Celeste: ...!
Tyrion: Celeste?
Celeste: ...I think I found something!
Celeste: I'm...[p/] not exactly sure what it is though...
Celeste pulls out a metallic shard with some sort of engraving on it.
Unlike the other shards,[p/] this one looks far less damaged.
The engraving on it looks like some sort of crest.
Aster: ...That's the crest of House von Sanctus!
Celeste: Isn't he the noble that's charging Dracogen?
Tyrion: Well,[p/] I doubt that [i]Lord von Sanctus[/i] was the second victim...
Tyrion: Aster.[p/] Do you know who would have a house emblem like this?
Aster: Hm...[p/] Normally,[p/] only the lord's retainers would have the emblems of his house.
Tyrion: Well, I doubt that Justin was the one who had this in his possession...
Celeste: Do you think one of von Sanctus's retainers fell into the vat that night?
Tyrion: It's definitely possible...[p/] But if that [i]did[/i] happen,[p/] why haven't we heard about it?
Aster: Lloyd von Sanctus [i]would[/i] have the resources to keep something like that out of the public eye.
Tyrion: The only way to know for sure would be to ask him ourselves...
Tyrion: But even if we [i]could[/i] talk to him,[p/] he would never cooperate with us.
Aster: ...
translation: Aster: ……

original: You glance at the prince.
Someone of his station would have no trouble meeting with Lord von Sanctus.
An idea begins to form in your mind.
Tyrion: Unless...
Aster: What is it, Mr. Cuthbert?
Tyrion: Aster,[p/] do you think you could help us interrogate Lord von Sanctus?
Aster: Really?![p/][s/] You need [i]my[/i] help?!
Tyrion: ...In this instance,[p/] it'd be very difficult to speak to him by ourselves.
Tyrion: But as the crown prince,[p/] he'd be much more inclined to speak with you.
Aster: Of course![p/][s/] I'd be happy to help!
You might be overplaying your hand by utilizing Aster this way.
You're still wary of the prince.[p/] Especially since he was one of the few mages at the scene.
Celeste: Hm...[p/] Will this really work, though...?
Tyrion: It's not ideal...[p/] But it's the only lead we have so far.
But it still bothers you.
Why haven't you found any bone matter from a second person...?
Maybe you're overthinking it.
You should pursue every lead and see where it takes you.
...And to do that,[p/] you need to find out where Lord von Sanctus is.
Tyrion: I'm surprised that the Inquisition is even here.
Tyrion: I thought you were all busy investigating Aster's missing ship.
Orym: W-[p/]Wait...[p/][s/] You know about that?!
The commander glances nervously at Aster.
Orym: W-[p/]We [i]wanted[/i] to put more of our people there.
Orym: B-[p/]but Lady Steelwind [i]insisted[/i] that we focus on the Dracogen case.
Aster: As you should.
Aster: I would much rather have you find justice for Justin Waye.
Aster: That's far more important than looking for some musty old ship.
Orym: R-[p/]Right... [mind="Is this kid for real...?" /]
Tyrion: Have you discovered anything about the magical traces here?
Orym: We [i]did[/i] take a look at it.[p/] And it's definitely suspicious.
Orym: The only rails with magical traces on them are these.
Orym: And the fact that we can still see 'em means that they were left within the last 48 hours.
Orym: It's looking pretty likely that someone used [b]transmutation[/b] on these rails that night.
Tyrion: It still doesn't make sense, though...
Tyrion: Why would someone weaken [i]these[/i] rails specifically?
Orym: I have no idea.[p/] I'm just as confused as you are.
Orym: If this is really foul play,[p/] then someone [i]knew[/i] that Justin or some other person would be in this exact place.
Tyrion: Has the Inquisition found any evidence to prove my theory?
Orym: You mean about a [i]second[/i] person falling into the vat?
Orym: Sorry, kid.[p/] But it ain't that simple.
Orym: The body of that Justin fella sort of...[p/] dissolved.
Aster: That's quite...[p/] gruesome.
Orym: If [i]another[/i] person had fallen in,[p/] their body would have dissolved too.
Orym: But we could only find some bone fragments,[p/] blood,[p/] and a lot of metallic shards.
Tyrion: Have you been able to use [b]divination[/b] magic to identify the bone fragments?
Orym: Yep.[p/] The ones we found [i]all[/i] belonged to Justin Waye.
Orym: No signs of bones from another person...
Tyrion: There wasn't any evidence of another person falling in...?
Could your theory have been incorrect, then?
Tyrion: Are you sure that you and Morrison saw a person fall into the vat, Aster?
Aster: I definitely saw [i]someone[/i] fall off of the walkway and break the guard rails...
Aster: Although,[p/] thinking back on it,[p/] I didn't recognize [i]who[/i] exactly that person was.
Aster: The harbourmaster and I were pretty far away.[p/] And it wasn't well-lit.
Celeste: Do you think the second victim's body [i]fully[/i] dissolved?
Celeste: That might explain why we can't find any bone matter from them.
Tyrion: No...[p/] If my theory is correct,[p/] the second victim fell in minutes [i]after[/i] Justin fell.
Tyrion: It wouldn't make sense if that person's body fully dissolved before Justin's.
But why can't you find any bone matter of this second person?
Celeste: Either way,[p/] Dracogen might want to hear about this.
Tyrion: If the liquid is so volatile,[p/] how were you able to take things [i]out[/i] of the vat?
Aster: Oh,[p/] the liquid isn't volatile [i]anymore[/i].
Aster: When the harbourmaster and I reported what we saw,[p/] the workers poured some sort of alchemical solution into the vat.
Orym: Yeah.[p/] According to them,[p/] that solution neutralized the [b]evocation[/b] magic in those chemicals.
Orym: From what I hear,[p/] the magical liquid in these vats is usually blue.
Orym: The solution that they poured in turned it green.
Aster: Yes.[p/] Unfortunately,[p/] it was too late.
Aster: By the time they'd neutralized the liquid,[p/] Justin's body had already mostly dissolved.
Orym: And if they hadn't neutralized it so quickly,[p/] we probably wouldn’t have found [i]anything[/i] from the victim.
Tyrion: I still can't believe that you've been the crown prince this entire time...
Aster: I wasn't [i]trying[/i] to deceive you.
Aster: I was just worried that you might treat me differently if you knew the truth.
Orym: O-[p/]Oh,[p/] right.
Orym: ...Should I call Steelwind over here for you?
Orym: She'll probably want to see you.
Aster: No...[p/] I think it would be best if you didn't.
Celeste: ...Oh, I remember now!
Celeste: If you're the crown prince,[p/] that makes Prosecutor Steelwind your fiancée.
Tyrion: ...!
translation: Tyrion: ……！

original: Right,[p/] Lady Frega mentioned that during the Nightgrave case!
[i]That's[/i] why the name "Aster" sounded so familiar.
You saw it in her thoughts.
Aster: Ugh...[p/] That Miriam...
Aster: She's caused me so much trouble by publicly revealing my marriage to Lady Steelwind.
Aster: I had hoped to keep it a secret for much longer.
Tyrion: Where [i]is[/i] Prosecutor Steelwind, anyways?
Tyrion: She always investigates these crime scenes herself.
Orym: Ah,[p/] she said she wanted to investigate the disappearing ship personally.
Orym: She seems really hellbent on finding the people responsible.
Orym: They [i]did[/i] attempt to kidnap the crown prince, after all.
Celeste: Aw,[p/] she must really care about you, Aster.
Aster: No...[p/] I highly doubt that.
Celeste: What?
Aster: ...Our marriage was arranged by our parents.
Aster: She had no say in the matter,[p/] and I know that she only tolerates me for the good of our kingdom.
Celeste: I-[p/]I'm sure she still cares about you.
Aster: No.[p/] I can tell by the way she behaves around me.
Aster: Her hands quiver with rage,[p/] and she can't even bear to look at me when I speak to her...
Orym: Damn...[p/] I can't believe she even treats the [i]crown prince[/i] like that.
Aster: She may be my fiancée...[p/] But our marriage is purely political.
Aster: She endures so much because of her name...
Orym: I guess you aristocrats have your own share of problems...
Orym: I never expected to see [i]you[/i] here.
Orym: Don't you only work on homicide cases?
Tyrion: Yeah...[p/] It's a bit of a long story.
Tyrion: I'm doing this as a favor to a friend.
Orym: Huh...[p/] I guess connections really [i]are[/i] everything in the world of commerce.
Orym: So you've got Tymora payrolling you.[p/] Eh,[p/] mage girl?
Orym: I saw your record,[p/] you were working pretty high-profile shit in the Eastern Kingdoms.
Orym: Isn't working for a law firm technically a downgrade for you?
Celeste: Not really.[p/] Ruby pays me [i]really[/i] well.
Celeste: I guess she has a lot of gold or something.
Orym: Hmph...[p/] Of course, she does.
Celeste: Anyways,[p/] this knucklehead wouldn't last a day without me guarding him.
Tyrion: Hey...
She's not wrong, though.
Orym: If [i]you're[/i] here, does that mean...?
Tyrion: Don't worry.[p/] Ms. Tymora's not here.
Orym: Ugh...[p/] Good.
Orym: Can't stand the sight of that woman.
Tyrion:...
Orym: Ugh...[p/] Steelwind always micromanages the Inquisition.
Orym: But now she's just dumping all of her work on me.
Orym: Honestly,[p/] I don't know which of the two is worse.
Being a subordinate of the prosecutor [i]does[/i] look like a stressful experience.
Orym: I can't believe I have to work a case [i]directly[/i] for a noble.
Orym: Dealing with their usual "requests" is bad enough.
Orym: Now I have to answer directly to Von Sanctus?
Tyrion: He [i]may[/i] be the lord of this region,[p/] but isn't he also a business competitor?
Tyrion: That [i]must[/i] be a conflict of interest.
Orym: Sure is.[p/] But you, of all people, should know how it is...
Tyrion: ...Do I have to worry about him interfering with the investigation?
Orym: I don't think so.
Orym: For better or for worse,[p/] Steelwind is really particular about not letting [i]anyone[/i] interfere with our work.
Orym: I'd [i]heard[/i] that the prince was exploring the town alone.
Orym: ...But I never imagined that he was with [i]you two[/i] the entire time.
Aster: My apologies.[p/] I'm aware of how uneasy the Kingsguard is about my actions.
Aster: But I wanted to explore the city without their presence.
...Actually,[p/] they're probably keeping an eye on him from a distance.
There isn't a chance that they'd let a prince wander the crowded city alone.
They're probably watching him right now.
Orym: I've seen some shit in my day...
Orym: But falling into a vat of acid...?[p/] I can't imagine much worse ways to go.
Celeste: Yeah...[p/] It's disturbing when you think about it.
That's all the more reason to get justice for his death.
Orym: Hmph...[p/] Magical traces in a damn [i]civil[/i] case.
Orym: You always know [i]exactly[/i] how to make my job harder.
Tyrion: It's your job to solve magical crimes, isn't it?
Tyrion: All I'm doing is bringing the truth to light.
Orym: Yeah, yeah.
Tyrion: Commander.[p/] Would you happen to know about a criminal named the Eyetaker?
Orym: ...You playing games with me or something, kid?
Tyrion: ...What?
Orym: Well,[p/] I don't know nothing about no "Eyetaker".
Tyrion: Okay...?
Tyrion: What do you think about [i]this[/i]?
Orym: Uh...[p/] I don't know what you were expecting.
Orym: But there's not much to say about that.
It'd be best to try something else.
translation: 最好问问别的。

original: Orym: Oh,[p/] it's you two.[p/] And who's this-?
Aster: ...
translation: Aster: ……

original: Orym: ...
Orym: Wait...![p/][s/] T-[p/][s/]The hell?!
Aster: U-[p/]Um...[p/] Commander,[p/] please don't-
Orym: What the hell are [i]you[/i] two doing with the crown prince?!
Celeste: ...What?!
Aster: Ah...
Aster: It appears that my cover has been "blown",[p/] as they say.
Tyrion: D-[p/][s/]Did he just say that you're the "crown prince"?!
Aster: *sigh*
Aster: Yes.[p/] My full name is Aster de Wyverngarde IV:[p/] heir to the throne of Wyverngarde.
This entire time...[p/][s/] You've been speaking to the heir to the throne?!
Aster: I was hoping that it wouldn't come to this.
Orym: O-[p/][s/]Oh...[p/] S-[p/]Sorry, Your...[p/] um-[p/][s/] ...Majesty!
Aster: Please.[p/] None of that.
Aster: I would much prefer if you all continued to call me "Aster".
Orym: N-[p/]No,[p/] I could never-
You've never seen the commander this flustered before.
Tyrion: ...Why did you find the need to hide this from us?
Aster: I...[p/] didn't want you to think less of me.
Aster: I admire your work, Mr. Cuthbert.
Aster: Which is why I was afraid you wouldn't speak with me if you knew the truth.
In a way,[p/] he was correct to assume that...
As a member of the royal family,[p/] he represents [i]everything[/i] that you and Ms. Tymora are fighting against.
But...[p/] He [i]does[/i] look like a sincere and genuine person.
At the very least,[p/] you haven't seen anything incriminating through the Eye of Horus.
Anyways,[p/] this complicates things greatly.
Aster is your primary suspect...[p/] So if he [i]did[/i] commit the murder,[p/] you would have to implicate a member of the royal family.
A nobleman is one thing...[p/] But would it even be possible to convict the Crown Prince...?
:Well...[p/] No matter what,[p/] you won't stop seeking justice.
:It doesn't matter [i]who[/i] you're facing:[p/] be they man,[p/] king,[p/] or god.
And princes aside,[p/] you came here to talk to the commander about his investigation.
Since Aster is accompanying you,[p/] he might be more inclined to share details with you.

original: Mosourika: That day,[p/] I was looking for Justin in the freight area.[p/] But I couldn't find him.
translation: Mosourika: 那天，[p/]我在货运区找贾斯汀，[p/]但我找不到他。

original: Mosourika: I decided to look for him in the refinery's main building.
translation: Mosourika: 我决定去炼油厂的主楼找他。

original: Mosourika: There was some kind of magical door leading into it,[p/] but it was unlocked.
translation: Mosourika: 有一道通往大楼的魔法门，[p/]但它没有上锁。

original: Mosourika: Mr. Dracogen must have disabled the lock.[p/] No one else could have disabled it.
translation: Mosourika: 一定是德拉科根先生让锁失效的，[p/]没有其他人能够做到。

original: Mosourika: Nothing really stopped me from entering the refinery building.
translation: Mosourika: 确实没有什么阻碍我进入炼油厂。

original: Player: Overflow
Player: Objection
Mosourika: Plenty of people could have disabled the locks.
translation: Mosourika: 很多人都可以让锁失效。

original: Mosourika: Maybe one of the employees got lazy and forcefully broke it.
translation: Mosourika: 可能一个员工犯懒了，用武力破坏了锁。

original: Mosourika: There was also that nobleman who was with Mr. Morrison.[p/] [i]He's[/i] a mage and he could have used magic to do it.
translation: Mosourika: 还有那位和莫里森女士一起的贵族，[p/]<u>他</u>是一名法师，完全可以用魔法做到。

original: Mosourika: It could have also been one of the Maintenance Constructs.[p/] I saw one working on the machines.[p/] Maybe one of [i]them[/i] broke the lock.
translation: Mosourika: 也有可能是维修构造体。[p/]我曾看到它们在维护机器,[p/]也许是<u>它们</u>中的某一个破坏了锁。

original: Player: Overflow
Player: Objection
Lloyd: It [i]is[/i] possible to order a Construct to complete a complex list of tasks.[p/] But doing so is ill-advised.
translation: Lloyd: <u>确实</u>有可能命令构造体去完成一系列复杂的任务。[p/]但这么做是不明智的。

original: Lloyd: I'm sure you observed this with the Nightgrave trial.[p/] Constructs are extremely prone to error when completing a long list of tasks.
translation: Lloyd: 我肯定你在奈特格雷夫一案中也注意到了这一点。[p/]构造体在完成一长串任务时极易出错。

original: Lloyd: According to the defense,[p/] the saboteur stole a Rod of Mending and used it to sabotage very [i]specific[/i] sections of the refinery.
translation: Lloyd: 根据辩方的说法，[p/]破坏者偷了一根修复之杖，并用它来破坏炼油厂的<u>特定</u>部分。

original: Lloyd: I would never trust a Construct to discreetly complete such an intricate set of tasks unsupervised.
translation: Lloyd: 我绝不会信任一个构造体在无人监督的情况下偷偷完成这样一套复杂精细的任务。

original: Lloyd: And before you ask,[p/] I was miles away from the refinery at the time of the accident.[p/] I have several associates who can confirm this alibi.
translation: Lloyd: 而且我要告诉你，[p/]事故发生时，我离炼油厂有好几英里远。[p/]我有几个熟人可以做这个不在场证明。

original: Lloyd: Therefore,[p/] I had no way of observing this Construct from afar.[p/] Nor did I have any way to communicate with it.
translation: Lloyd: 所以，[p/]我是没有办法在远处看着这个构造体的。[p/]我也无法与它进行沟通。

original: Player: Overflow
Player: Objection
Noah: I was showing a visitor around the city.[p/] And for some reason,[p/] he really wanted to see the Aurinax Arcane Refinery.
Noah: He was inspecting the machines there.[p/] When,[p/] suddenly,[p/] Mosourika ran up to us.
Noah: She was desperately trying to tell us something,[p/] but there was just too much noise.
Noah: After a while,[p/] she just pointed at the walkway overlooking the refinery.[p/] That's where we saw someone fall into that accursed vat.
Noah: ...There was a guard rail that [i]should[/i] have prevented him from falling.[p/] But he broke through it as he fell.
Noah: Mosourika pointed it out.[p/] That's when we saw Justin fall.
Noah: My companion stood there with me.[p/] He also saw Justin fall.
Noah: It was a bit far away.[p/] So, I couldn't see if there was any rust on the guard rail.

Mosourika: I was at the refinery when I heard a strange sound from the walkway.
Mosourika: When I looked to see what it was,[p/] I saw that Justin had tumbled over the walkway's guard rail.
Mosourika: But he hadn't fallen into the vat yet.[p/] I saw him barely hanging onto the edge of the platform.
Mosourika: I didn't know how to get to the walkway from there.[p/] So I looked around for help and found Mr. Morrison.
Mosourika: After that, he must have seen Justin lose his grip of the ledge and fall into the vat.
